commit_message:
Networking guide: Guaranteed Minimum Bandwidth

High-level overall and low-level neutron docs for the
Guaranteed Minimum Bandwidth feature.

Change-Id: I27224250956b3b940d6372bd46afbdd11e0ce284
Closes-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

[{'created': '2019-03-13 16:30:28.000000000', 'message': "pass endpoint interface to Ironic client

Via change [1], ironicclient began to use endpoint_filter in the
version negotiation code path, whereas it was previously unused if a
fully-qualified endpoint had already been determined. Suddenly it was
important that the `interface` part of this endpoint_filter be correct.

Prior to ironicclient change [2], there was no way to pass an
appropriate `interface` value through ironicclient's initialization, so
the ironicclient used from nova would always end up with the default
value, `public`, in the endpoint_filter. This would break in clouds
lacking a public ironic API endpoint (see the referenced bug).

With this change, we pass the value of the (standard, per ksa)
`valid_interfaces` ironic config option into the ironicclient
initialization, where (if and only if the ironicclient fix [2] is also
present) it eventually gets passed through to the ksa Adapter
initialization (which is set up to accept values from exactly that conf
option) to wind up in the endpoint_filter.

The effect is that nova's ironicclient will actually be using the
interface from nova.conf throughout. (Because `valid_interfaces` is also
used in recommended configuration setups - i.e. those that use the
service catalog to determine API endpoints - to construct the
endpoint_override used to initialize the ironicclient, the value used
during version negotiation should be in sync with that used for regular
API calls.)

[1] I42b66daea1f4397273a3f4eb1638abafb3bb28ce
[2] I610836e5038774621690aca88b2aee25670f0262

Change-Id: I5f78d21c39ed2fd58d2a0f3649116e39883d5a2c
closes-bug: 1818295
(cherry picked from commit e082bdc166cb8215576801e0c89ef1fe771681ed)
"}]
commit_message:
pass endpoint interface to Ironic client

Via change [1], ironicclient began to use endpoint_filter in the
version negotiation code path, whereas it was previously unused if a
fully-qualified endpoint had already been determined. Suddenly it was
important that the `interface` part of this endpoint_filter be correct.

Prior to ironicclient change [2], there was no way to pass an
appropriate `interface` value through ironicclient's initialization, so
the ironicclient used from nova would always end up with the default
value, `public`, in the endpoint_filter. This would break in clouds
lacking a public ironic API endpoint (see the referenced bug).

With this change, we pass the value of the (standard, per ksa)
`valid_interfaces` ironic config option into the ironicclient
initialization, where (if and only if the ironicclient fix [2] is also
present) it eventually gets passed through to the ksa Adapter
initialization (which is set up to accept values from exactly that conf
option) to wind up in the endpoint_filter.

The effect is that nova's ironicclient will actually be using the
interface from nova.conf throughout. (Because `valid_interfaces` is also
used in recommended configuration setups - i.e. those that use the
service catalog to determine API endpoints - to construct the
endpoint_override used to initialize the ironicclient, the value used
during version negotiation should be in sync with that used for regular
API calls.)

[1] I42b66daea1f4397273a3f4eb1638abafb3bb28ce
[2] I610836e5038774621690aca88b2aee25670f0262

Change-Id: I5f78d21c39ed2fd58d2a0f3649116e39883d5a2c
closes-bug: 1818295
(cherry picked from commit e082bdc166cb8215576801e0c89ef1fe771681ed)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-04 14:24:47.000000000', 'message': "ironic: check fresh data when sync_power_state doesn't line up

We return cached data to sync_power_state to avoid pummeling the ironic
API. However, this can lead to a race condition where an instance is
powered on, but nova thinks it should be off and calls stop(). Check
again without the cache when this happens to make sure we don't
unnecessarily kill an instance.

Closes-Bug: #1815791
Change-Id: I907b69eb689cf6c169a4869cfc7889308ca419d5
(cherry picked from commit 19cb8280232fd3b0ba0000a475d061ea9fb10e1a)
"}]
commit_message:
ironic: check fresh data when sync_power_state doesn't line up

We return cached data to sync_power_state to avoid pummeling the ironic
API. However, this can lead to a race condition where an instance is
powered on, but nova thinks it should be off and calls stop(). Check
again without the cache when this happens to make sure we don't
unnecessarily kill an instance.

Closes-Bug: #1815791
Change-Id: I907b69eb689cf6c169a4869cfc7889308ca419d5
(cherry picked from commit 19cb8280232fd3b0ba0000a475d061ea9fb10e1a)

commit_message:
APIv2 jobs also on the gate queue, add the py37 job

Enable the API v2 tests also on the gate queue, in addition
to the check queue.

Add the py37 unit test job and complete the list of the
available virtual environments in the envlist key of tox.ini.

Remove the usage of os_image and os_nova_flavor: Zuul now uses
Ansible 2.7, which requires a version of openstacksdk not available
in queens and pike.

The addition of the py37 job implements the following task:
Story: 2004073
Task: 27450
Change-Id: I016f674b3bc3e4617ee724261e6a0c22d8520fbc

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-21 10:32:55.000000000', 'message': 'Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7bc035a571db5b6347c2d92c1b664a2b24158780
'}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7bc035a571db5b6347c2d92c1b664a2b24158780

commit_message:
Ignore first local port update notification

Ovs-agent local port notification will be sent during
the first rpc loop. This will cause these ports to
be processed twice. After this patch, the port update
notification will be ignored in the first RPC loop
(iteration num 0).

Related-Bug: #1813703

Change-Id: I93973ccd211a5d59734cd00672b8057d19555f18

strictly speacking since we are well after the feature freeze and rc 1 is in 2 days this proably should not merge currently under our release rules.

cyborg dose not explcitly state its release model in the governace repo

https://github.com/openstack/governance/blob/9d4507b4cfe391e30a810ee1f577531e11d7d2c5/reference/projects.yaml#L306-L330

looking at 
https://github.com/openstack/releases/blob/master/doc/source/reference/release_models.rst
cybog shoudl be using either
cycle with rc which is  likely the most suable 
https://github.com/openstack/releases/blob/master/doc/source/reference/release_models.rst#cycle-with-rc
or cycle with intermediary
https://github.com/openstack/releases/blob/master/doc/source/reference/release_models.rst#cycle-with-intermediary

as such im surpised to see this feautre merging dufin the RC pahse without an email to the mailing list asking for a feature freeze exception given cyboge has had its 1.0 release and the stable/stine branch has not been created yet'}, {'account_id': 17813, 'date': '2019-03-21 04:47:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 17813, 'date': '2019-03-21 04:50:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

'}, {'created': '2018-07-12 07:29:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add gpu driver

1. Imply gpu driver of passthrough mode.
2. Pre-configure for GPU passthrough(We should move this guide to admin
guide doc later):
a) Edit /etc/default/grub
   Modify GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX=’… quiet’ to GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX=’… quiet
   intel_iommu=on’
b) grub2-mkconfig -o /boot/efi/EFI/centos/grub.cfg
c) Reboot compute node.
d) Check it is successful or not.
   dmesg | grep -e DMAR -e IOMMU
   You would see something echoed.
References:
https://pve.proxmox.com/wiki/Pci_passthrough

Story: 2002954

commit_message:
Add gpu driver

1. Imply gpu driver of passthrough mode.
2. Pre-configure for GPU passthrough(We should move this guide to admin
guide doc later):
a) Edit /etc/default/grub
   Modify GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX=’… quiet’ to GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX=’… quiet
   intel_iommu=on’
b) grub2-mkconfig -o /boot/efi/EFI/centos/grub.cfg
c) Reboot compute node.
d) Check it is successful or not.
   dmesg | grep -e DMAR -e IOMMU
   You would see something echoed.
References:
https://pve.proxmox.com/wiki/Pci_passthrough

3.Remove unused import.
4.Fix spelling mistakes.
5.Fix _match_nova_addr, becase addr in os-acc is like 0000:00:06.0

Story: 2002954
Change-Id: I555b656f80b32eafdc24f9ba81ddc9af416d95e9

[{'created': '2019-03-20 14:17:09.000000000', 'message': "Only attempt to start previous MariaDB if the image is available

On upgrade of undercloud from 14 to 15, we can't run this task
always. The old MariaDB image was in Docker, but after the upgrade
only Podman might be available, and it wouldn't have the previous
MariaDB image available. Our best option here is likely skipping the
redo log cleanup and hope that the redo log is clean. If this happens
to cause problems in the wild, we might need a completely different
solution (a parameter pointing to old MariaDB image url so that we can
re-download it etc.).

commit_message:
Only attempt to start previous MariaDB if the image is available

On upgrade of undercloud from Rocky to Stein, we can't run this task
always. The old MariaDB image was in Docker, but after the upgrade
only Podman might be available, and it wouldn't have the previous
MariaDB image available. Our best option here is likely skipping the
redo log cleanup and hope that the redo log is clean. If this happens
to cause problems in the wild, we might need a completely different
solution (a parameter pointing to old MariaDB image url so that we can
re-download it etc.).

Change-Id: I51a338d840190c8931ab40692f727e5e0638ba40
Closes-Bug: #1821013

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-19 19:56:13.000000000', 'message': "Don't persist RequestSpec.requested_destination

The RequestSpec.requested_destination, similar to the
retry field, is per-request/operation, and persisting
it can caues issues when subsequent move requests.

For example, if you cold migrate a server to a specific
host and then live migrate that server without specifying
a host, the requested target host from the cold migrate
is sent to the scheduler for the live migration, but since
that is where the instance is already running, it's
rejected with NoValidHost.

This is a similar issue to the need to call
RequestSpec.reset_forced_destinations() in all move operations
in conductor. However, rather than try to whack this mole in
every place the request spec is sent to the scheduler, like
reset_forced_destinations() is used, we simply don't need to
persist the requested_destination field since it's just a
vehicle to tell the scheduler which host we want.

The related functional regression test is updated to show
the bug is now fixed.

Conflicts:
      nova/objects/request_spec.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
Icb295bbd8c83e2e340a7ac3ecc1f159e0db7c7b1 in Queens.

Change-Id: I2a78f0754c63381c57e7e1c610d0938b6df0f537
Closes-Bug: #1797580
(cherry picked from commit ce3af5e33ae6843411e611e81c6ca1c21e0f1e09)
(cherry picked from commit 954b2004a1daa43d4dff0694e6e5cdb9630a441b)
"}, {'created': '2018-12-14 02:57:06.000000000', 'message': "Don't persist RequestSpec.requested_destination

The RequestSpec.requested_destination, similar to the
retry field, is per-request/operation, and persisting
it can caues issues when subsequent move requests.

For example, if you cold migrate a server to a specific
host and then live migrate that server without specifying
a host, the requested target host from the cold migrate
is sent to the scheduler for the live migration, but since
that is where the instance is already running, it's
rejected with NoValidHost.

This is a similar issue to the need to call
RequestSpec.reset_forced_destinations() in all move operations
in conductor. However, rather than try to whack this mole in
every place the request spec is sent to the scheduler, like
reset_forced_destinations() is used, we simply don't need to
persist the requested_destination field since it's just a
vehicle to tell the scheduler which host we want.

The related functional regression test is updated to show

Conflicts:
      nova/objects/request_spec.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change

(cherry picked from commit ce3af5e33ae6843411e611e81c6ca1c21e0f1e09)
(cherry picked from commit 954b2004a1daa43d4dff0694e6e5cdb9630a441b)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't persist RequestSpec.requested_destination

The RequestSpec.requested_destination, similar to the
retry field, is per-request/operation, and persisting
it can caues issues when subsequent move requests.

For example, if you cold migrate a server to a specific
host and then live migrate that server without specifying
a host, the requested target host from the cold migrate
is sent to the scheduler for the live migration, but since
that is where the instance is already running, it's
rejected with NoValidHost.

This is a similar issue to the need to call
RequestSpec.reset_forced_destinations() in all move operations
in conductor. However, rather than try to whack this mole in
every place the request spec is sent to the scheduler, like
reset_forced_destinations() is used, we simply don't need to
persist the requested_destination field since it's just a
vehicle to tell the scheduler which host we want.

The related functional regression test is updated to show
the bug is now fixed.

Conflicts:
      nova/objects/request_spec.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
Icb295bbd8c83e2e340a7ac3ecc1f159e0db7c7b1 in Queens.

Change-Id: I2a78f0754c63381c57e7e1c610d0938b6df0f537
Closes-Bug: #1797580
(cherry picked from commit ce3af5e33ae6843411e611e81c6ca1c21e0f1e09)
(cherry picked from commit 954b2004a1daa43d4dff0694e6e5cdb9630a441b)

commit_message:
Skip a cycle instead of retrying if a metric is not found in gnocchi

In case a metric is not found in gnocchi, return nothing instead of retrying.
The metric is unlikely to be available during the next collection cycle.

Change-Id: I4b954b146b800255554449bb19eb4bed3cb87dd4

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I37f2373159fa7be5de56f5edf711389f422c989f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-20 01:01:03.000000000', 'message': 'Add sleep in cinder cron jobs

The current cron job for purge is executed at the precisely same time,
if we deploy multiple controller nodes with database clusterd,
for example using Galera cluster, it could cause DB spike.

This patch introduces a randomized sleep before executing purge job,
to avoid such kind of collision.

This commit is a kind of cherry-pick of the commit in puppet-nova
with change id I093a713a4f0ba48686de615aa8cb22b17a56917b .

Co-Authored-By: Rajesh Tailor <ratailor@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I36cf5f1e66fed580786970d9a953d983539a6e43
(cherry picked from commit I36cf5f1e66fed580786970d9a953d983539a6e43)
'}]
commit_message:
Add sleep in cinder cron jobs

The current cron job for purge is executed at the precisely same time,
if we deploy multiple controller nodes with database clusterd,
for example using Galera cluster, it could cause DB spike.

This patch introduces a randomized sleep before executing purge job,
to avoid such kind of collision.

This commit is a kind of cherry-pick of the commit in puppet-nova
with change id I093a713a4f0ba48686de615aa8cb22b17a56917b .

Co-Authored-By: Rajesh Tailor <ratailor@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I36cf5f1e66fed580786970d9a953d983539a6e43
(cherry picked from commit I36cf5f1e66fed580786970d9a953d983539a6e43)

commit_message:
Remove "msg" from tasks in ansible roles

It looks that 'msg' isn't valid attribute for a Task and
it cause problem with jobs which uses this role.

Change-Id: I43d09e645f60526d251703ce7ee91c29281f1eeb
Closes-Bug: #1820993

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Id6d3c6cc554dd342f54c7fe827d9a016736d6c4d

This adds the test timeout field to all charts with helm tests
defined in the OSH Armada manifest, and also updates the release
timeouts for releases known to take longer than usual

This also updates chart overrides to achieve parity between the
standard multinode job and the Armada periodic jobs to reduce the
potential for issues arising from configuration deltas

commit_message:
OSH: Add/Update Armada timeouts, update config overrides

This adds the test timeout field to all charts with helm tests
defined in the OSH Armada manifest, and also updates the release
timeouts for releases known to take longer than usual

This also updates chart overrides to achieve parity between the
standard multinode job and the Armada periodic jobs to reduce the
potential for issues arising from configuration deltas

Change-Id: Id9ba223fbd35ee213db346bbc230a844632e15d2

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I079073ecc7defcae92250100362020e53e55bf26

(1 comment)

Thank you Ilya, LGTM, do we need a release note here?'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2019-03-07 08:34:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thank you Ilya.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-03-07 10:12:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thank you, guys!

> Also I'm not sure if it is right thing to as adding boot_mode capability would change the behavior of get_boot_mode() [1] which has been used at several places. 

The idea behind this change is to align with the in-band inspection behavior [1].

> Moreover with 'redfish' hardware type is capable of getting/setting the boot mode [2], it may not be good idea to populate this capability.

May be that would be an alternative or complimentary approach? If we get all hw types' `prepare_ramdisk` calling `sync_boot_mode` [2]?

1. https://docs.openstack.org/ironic-inspector/ocata/usage.html#boot-mode
2. https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/ironic/drivers/modules/boot_mode_utils.py#L71"}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-03-07 18:58:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2019-03-08 06:18:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Thank you Ilya. In case of Ironic inspector boot mode capability is not inspected by default [1]. In that sense user is going to make an explicit choice for that capability. 

Also, you need to fix this pep8 errors [2] and add release notes.
[1] https://github.com/openstack/ironic-inspector/blob/master/ironic_inspector/conf/capabilities.py#L29-L37
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/57/641357/3/check/openstack-tox-pep8/26ee251/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-03-07_19_08_20_708133'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-03-08 06:47:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

> In case of Ironic inspector boot mode capability is not inspected by default [1]. In that sense user is going to make an explicit choice for that capability. 


Right, does it make sense to introduce similar option? Why the user may not want to have boot_mode always discovered and set?

>  Moreover with 'redfish' hardware type is capable of getting/setting the boot mode [2], it may not be good idea to populate this capability.

Is it a plausible scenario that the user has `inspect_interface=redfish` and `management_interface=ipmitool`? I am just trying to understand if this patch makes sense at all?"}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-03-08 07:12:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-03-08 07:19:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2019-03-08 20:06:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2019-03-12 06:36:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

The 'boot_mode' capability was envisioned as a boot mode that would be used in the subsequent deploy and not as the current boot mode [1]. We have code in place to change the boot mode of the bare metal during provisioning based on the value being set. The Ironic-Inspector being in-band, it has a limitation that it cannot determine all the supported boot modes on the system. By setting the boot_mode capability to current boot mode, we are changing the behavior of the driver. I think better to guard this with configuration parameter.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/specs/9.1/add-new-oob-properties-to-ilo-drivers.html"}, {'account_id': 18320, 'date': '2019-03-12 09:30:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Set boot_mode in node properties during Redfish introspection

If Redfish OOB inspection returns current boot mode of the
node, add this boot mode into node properties/capabilities.

The idea behind this change is to align with the in-band
inspection behavior [1].

1. https://docs.openstack.org/ironic-inspector/ocata/usage.html#boot-mode

Story: 1668487
Task: 29855
Change-Id: I11de35fa87512d12eb6a259b26e88cd94e4a803d

commit_message:
We have to allow httpd to listen on those ports in some cases.

Apparently, at least 8787 has a selinux type already, preventing
httpd to listen on it.

Change-Id: I03eacda0d8eaaa76915d8382bc21e8aa15c88265
Closes-Bug: #1821025

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I875d54770405597d91c32155e3699e536824a5e6

commit_message:
Rework the "reporting" tab

This is a rework of the Project/Reporting tag. Its main goal
is to draw the "Cumulative cost repartition" piechart without D3pie,
in order to get rid of that dependency.

Work items:

* Remove d3pie dependency, and replace the piechart by a D3-only donut.

* Use consistent colors between the piechart and time chart.

* Add a color legend.

Change-Id: Ie2207be3c027b6042251fbcb7d93a3cd5455ad3d
Story: 2003578
Task: 24923

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-18 15:27:27.000000000', 'message': "Fix MariaDB 10.3 upgrade

There are a couple of issues with the mariadb image currently.

1. it doesn't include mysql_upgrade on CentOS/RHEL. It is necessary to
   run this after an upgrade of MariaDB. This is fixed by installing
   mariadb-server-utils.

2. it inherits the standard dumb-init entrypoint from the base image,
   which includes a --single-child argument. That causes signals to be
   forwarded only to the process executed by dumb-init, which in the
   case of kolla-ansible is mysqld_safe, however mysqld_safe ignores
   SIGTERM. After a timeout, Docker then forcibly kills the container.
   Executing dumb-init without --single-child ensures the TERM signal is
   sent to mysqld, allowing it to shutdown gracefully.

Change-Id: I1a450736721863b91be1ea3d3c8948990de9fdeb
Closes-Bug: #1820325
"}, {'created': '2019-03-18 17:34:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix MariaDB 10.3 upgrade

1. it doesn't include mysql_upgrade on CentOS/RHEL. It is necessary to

2. it inherits the standard dumb-init entrypoint from the base image,

   forwarded only to the process executed by dumb-init, which in the
   case of kolla-ansible is mysqld_safe, however mysqld_safe ignores
   SIGTERM. After a timeout, Docker then forcibly kills the container.
   Executing dumb-init without --single-child ensures the TERM signal is

commit_message:
Fix MariaDB 10.3 upgrade

There are a couple of issues with the mariadb image currently.

1. it doesn't include mysql_upgrade on CentOS/RHEL. It is necessary to
   run this after an upgrade of MariaDB. This is fixed by installing
   mariadb-server-utils.

2. it inherits the standard dumb-init entrypoint from the base image,
   which includes a --single-child argument. That causes signals to be
   forwarded only to the process executed by dumb-init, which in the
   case of kolla-ansible is mysqld_safe, however mysqld_safe ignores
   SIGTERM. After a timeout, Docker then forcibly kills the container.
   Executing dumb-init without --single-child ensures the TERM signal is
   sent to mysqld, allowing it to shutdown gracefully.

Change-Id: I1a450736721863b91be1ea3d3c8948990de9fdeb
Closes-Bug: #1820325

commit_message:
monasca, tempest: install librdkafka-dev to get it built for non-x86/source

fixes build issue under Debian:buster on AArch64:

In file included from confluent_kafka/src/confluent_kafka.c:17:
confluent_kafka/src/confluent_kafka.h:22:10: fatal error: librdkafka/rdkafka.h: No such file or directory
 #include <librdkafka/rdkafka.h>
          ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
compilation terminated.
error: command 'aarch64-linux-gnu-gcc' failed with exit status 1

Under Ubuntu it is still broken because librdkafka is too old.

Change-Id: I1e54645ea5805f985c9bd04f9936ea3edbebfd31

commit_message:
Implement Security Context for Registry

Implement a pod security context for the following Registry resources:
 - Registry server deployment
 - Registry proxy daemonset

Change-Id: I6fab83c3d54f32a70e4e77e21feba04dd62d751c

[{'created': '2019-03-20 06:46:16.000000000', 'message': "Install and configure tmpwatch for log cleanup

Installing and configuring tmpwatch allows to get rid of some
ugly things in logrotate configuration. As the container has no
network access anymore, we have to install the tool on the host
directly - this isn't that bad.

In order to avoid issues with logrotate manage logs, we explicitely
exclude patterns manage in the specific logorate configuration.

Also, always in order to avoid issues and ensure logrotate does its
own cleanup, we clean files one day later.

Change-Id: Ic666388d9ba7556e7b68ab2fc1082957a9e26552
(cherry picked from commit 836705161cfdd847c4ef0ff37f0e5708b520e763)
"}]
commit_message:
Install and configure tmpwatch for log cleanup

Installing and configuring tmpwatch allows to get rid of some
ugly things in logrotate configuration. As the container has no
network access anymore, we have to install the tool on the host
directly - this isn't that bad.

In order to avoid issues with logrotate manage logs, we explicitely
exclude patterns manage in the specific logorate configuration.

Also, always in order to avoid issues and ensure logrotate does its
own cleanup, we clean files one day later.

Change-Id: Ic666388d9ba7556e7b68ab2fc1082957a9e26552
(cherry picked from commit 836705161cfdd847c4ef0ff37f0e5708b520e763)

commit_message:
Workaround for postgres job with ubuntu bionic

Adding a firewall rule as workaround to help TFTP traffic
necessary for Ironic to work with PXE on Ubuntu Bionic.
Inspired by https://review.openstack.org/643570
Thanks Harald!

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/642507

[{'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2019-03-08 03:51:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2019-03-08 07:35:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-03-20 14:01:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-03-21 03:00:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This was made before https://review.openstack.org/#/c/643387/ was merged so it used the old style URL for constraints.

It should now be https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/stein which will currently point to http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt?h=master until requirements branches when it will switch to http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt?h=stable/stein auto-magically :)

I'll edit ASAP."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-03-21 03:29:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2019-03-21 06:30:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-03-21 13:23:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-07 10:36:33.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I8918b66575788025e4041df0af2d44708b9823f1
"}, {'created': '2019-03-21 03:29:47.000000000', 'message': 'Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8918b66575788025e4041df0af2d44708b9823f1
'}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8918b66575788025e4041df0af2d44708b9823f1

subject: Soften the rabbitmq version pin
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-21 12:22:13.000000000', 'message': "Soften the rabbitmq version pin

With version 5.7.4 the rabbitmq cookbook should be working for us again.
However, we also learned that with the upcoming 6.x version of the
cookbook only versions >= 3.7.x of rabbitmq will be supported, which
isn't available as distro version at least for Ubuntu LTS releases yet.
So we change this pin into a soft match, allowing for updates within the
5.x stable branch, but blocking 6.x.

Add patch version bump for stable cherry-pick.

Change-Id: Id647f10fd5d4b69b441c4f8de8c325ec0032d9ea
(cherry picked from commit 818851f79060d532054e2f90848d40a70fce4084)
"}]
commit_message:
Soften the rabbitmq version pin

With version 5.7.4 the rabbitmq cookbook should be working for us again.
However, we also learned that with the upcoming 6.x version of the
cookbook only versions >= 3.7.x of rabbitmq will be supported, which
isn't available as distro version at least for Ubuntu LTS releases yet.
So we change this pin into a soft match, allowing for updates within the
5.x stable branch, but blocking 6.x.

Add patch version bump for stable cherry-pick.

Change-Id: Id647f10fd5d4b69b441c4f8de8c325ec0032d9ea
(cherry picked from commit 818851f79060d532054e2f90848d40a70fce4084)

William I have done extensive testing with the 3PAR driver, as you know I am the original author.   I have added comments to the bug explaining why the online copy is a bad thing to use in the driver and also provided tests in which the driver fails and leaves many hidden snapshots on the 3PAR, which will eventually lead to a 3PAR failure itself.   This needs to be removed.'}, {'account_id': 21863, 'date': '2017-10-24 14:33:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

- dsvm-veritas-hyperscale-cinder-driver http://52.35.51.88/06/499806/3/check/dsvm-veritas-hyperscale-cinder-driver/ee78586 : SUCCESS in 1h 30m 22s'}, {'account_id': 22664, 'date': '2017-10-24 15:08:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

> William I have done extensive testing with the 3PAR driver, as you
 > know I am the original author.   I have added comments to the bug
 > explaining why the online copy is a bad thing to use in the driver
 > and also provided tests in which the driver fails and leaves many
 > hidden snapshots on the 3PAR, which will eventually lead to a 3PAR
 > failure itself.   This needs to be removed.

- With this patch we have performed some experimentation, and we have seen latency number increase in some cases.

But I agree generally for the image volume cache use cases the target volume will be slightly bigger than the cached image volume (with glance image contents)
And for the above scenario, it will use a offline copy due to target and source volume size mismatch.
 
This is the case with image_volume_cache_enabled flag and we have measured for cache hit and cache-miss scenario.

+-----------------------------------------+--------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                         | 10 Concurrent clone operation  | 10 Concurrent clone operation        | 10 Concurrent create volume of  4GB size     | 
|                                         | (source  20 GB Empty volume)   | (source 20 GB having 4GB Data in it )|         (cache hit scenario with 4GB image)  |
+-----------------------------------------+--------------------------------+--------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------+
| Without this patch (online copy feature)|	15.304 sec                 |      	16.096 sec	          |   20.423 sec                                 |
| With patch (no online copy)	          |     12.849 sec	           |            85.038 sec	          |   85.95 sec                                  |
+-----------------------------------------+--------------------------------+--------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------+

- Temporary snapshot cleanup problem was handled in this patch on Pike timeframe -- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/495125/ 
- Parallel copy of source to target volume (create volume using a source volume --source-volid option) when sizes of source/target are same will take hit by this 
  change. This benefit can be ok to be loosed given that so many other gains / reliability we get from this change going in.'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2017-10-24 15:38:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Comments from Eric need to be addressed yet.'}, {'account_id': 22664, 'date': '2017-10-31 13:06:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

- We wanted some sort of configuration param to enable/disable online copy feature of 3PAR Cinder driver. The reason being we have some customer usecases where the cinder create is done with --source-volid , and the size of the source/target volume size are equivalent. 

If this change is merged, it would affect some of our customers in terms of increased latency for the volume create operation, which is very evident from the table which I pointed in my earlier comment.

- Some of the limitations around online copy which we pointed in the launchpad bug will be pursued with the 3PAR Engineering Team for resolution.'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2017-11-01 17:40:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

William, I addressed that issue in the bug.  Basically, you can't ever guarantee that the online copy will work in the case where the 3PAR is being used from Cinder.   The 3PAR has a limitation of only allowing 2 or 3 online copies on the entire array at any one time.   Also, it leaves hidden unremovable snapshots in the case of a cancelled or killed copy, which can't get removed with out manual intervention.  Without removing those hidden snapshots, the CPG will fill up and you won't be able to provision against it again.   Online copy just simply doesn't work for a cloud deployment."}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2017-11-01 17:40:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 15831, 'date': '2017-11-01 18:09:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
3PAR remove online copy capability

This patch removes the 3PAR online copy capability in the driver
for cloning operations.   This fixes many problems with cloning
that leaves volumes in a state on the 3PAR that can't be changed,
until the background (online) copy is completed.  This eventually
orphaned temporary snapshots and hidden snapshots that caused
problems during delete_volume time.

Change-Id: Ia0a814e5817e4fdd1b812eb73ada292abea34ccf
Closes-Bug: 1657227

commit_message:
Disable multiattach feature for stable branches before stein

Below patch enabled the multiattach feature in devstack ceph job
without branch variant. Multiattach feature is only available
from stein.
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/638499/2

This commit makes two variant of job with multiattach enable from
stein  onwards only.

Change-Id: Ib0a5667a6125fa5ae430086db93baf5a53be4877
Closes-Bug: #1820098

commit_message:
Remove packethost from nodepool builders

This provider is not being used, and is being problematic in receiving
new image uploads (causing disk space to fill up). Let's just remove it.

Change-Id: Ib82cc0cf97fc2d7d39c83ac3486e8d829ceed6d4

commit_message:
Pin sensu mailer and slack plugins

The 4.0.0 release of the mailer plugin requires Ruby 2.3+, which is not
avaiable in CentOS/RHEL7. Pin it to the 3.0.0 release, which is
supported. While we're here, also pin the slack plugin.

Both use the pessimistic version operator, as used in the sensu-client
image.

Change-Id: Idac8cb696c81c7413a3da79b4868f556ef36fc8d
Closes-Bug: #1820594

commit_message:
Use virtual package for ansible

Rather than specify ansible-python3 or ansible, we can try the virtual
package for the python specific version of ansible.

Change-Id: I246edfaf8cc0ee12852c18c6f9027e48880797a4

commit_message:
Install qemu-system in nova-libvirt on ubuntu

In https://review.openstack.org/643308 we installed only the x86 qemu
emulator due to an issue in nova when installing all emulators via
qemu-system.

The nova issue should be fixed by https://review.openstack.org/643458,
at which point it should be safe to merge this patch.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/643458
Change-Id: I1c045d85a8473725baf907d7c6ecb780b8f6748d

commit_message:
Update programming language mentioned in setup.cfg

As py35 has been dropped and py36, py37 jobs are running, so
updated the setup.cfg accordingly.

Change-Id: I85af2a9116d9b15a4fa6b35cb562f4de277a828f

commit_message:
Introduce clean_package_cache

Default to true (to maintain backward compatibility), this parameter
will allow to disable the Package cache cleaning when building the Kolla
images.

In TripleO, we are investigating how we can accelerate the builds by not
cleaning the Yum cache and this patch will help us to do so.

Also included same for deb package_install method.

Co-Authored-By: Jon Schlueter <jschluet@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0adc85302dfe0411d362c899f3e0d6a0019680d4

Change-Id: I4f6b101195d245e14f6600b1edd9caafd25dcaac

commit_message:
install ncurses explicitly for tput for rpm distro

tput is used in PS1 env, but nothing explicitly
makes sure that it is installed.  Red Hat's ubi8 base image
only contains ncurses-base and ncurses-libs but not ncurses rpm
which provides the tput cli

Change-Id: I4f6b101195d245e14f6600b1edd9caafd25dcaac

commit_message:
Fix RST formatting issues in README

Formatting issues in the README file cause the pypi package upload to
fail by rejecting its use as the long description of the package. This
needs to be corrected before a release can be performed.

Change-Id: I3cdc7ca2175975980d32196193dc9d7bedfafca2
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein
messages:
[{'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-03-21 03:49:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-03-21 03:52:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I1f6ac3618f24b1a06f6ce111666d6f9eb79ab405 shoudl have been held until the requirements repo created the stable/stein branch.  Merging before that means that testing for stein is unconstrained (due to the constraints url 404'ing).

Fortunately we recently landed work in the release repo to fix that race.  This change update the URL to the new URL that will always exist."}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2019-03-21 12:10:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-21 03:49:37.000000000', 'message': 'Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ib18b7e53242c78d51cd57cbae6b4ee79f3b5f5d0
'}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ib18b7e53242c78d51cd57cbae6b4ee79f3b5f5d0

commit_message:
Ignore "start" command if instance appears to be running

This helps preserving backward-compatible behaviour, as previous
implementation has required the user to explicitly "start" enabled
instances. With current virtualbmc, only the master process needs to
be started.

Change-Id: I3f95cdbd497f7ae3e06d37bb6afac17331f0469b

commit_message:
Bump lower libvirt-python to 3.7

Otherwise it mismatches the libvirt binary on bionic
and fails to build.

Change-Id: Ic7821d2e9ac764c980db1a2708ee3441855f3830

subject: Soften the rabbitmq version pin
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-21 10:32:25.000000000', 'message': "Soften the rabbitmq version pin

With version 5.7.4 the rabbitmq cookbook should be working for us again.
However, we also learned that with the upcoming 6.x version of the
cookbook only versions >= 3.7.x of rabbitmq will be supported, which
isn't available as distro version at least for Ubuntu LTS releases yet.
So we change this pin into a soft match, allowing for updates within the
5.x stable branch, but blocking 6.x.

Change-Id: Id647f10fd5d4b69b441c4f8de8c325ec0032d9ea
"}]
commit_message:
Soften the rabbitmq version pin

With version 5.7.4 the rabbitmq cookbook should be working for us again.
However, we also learned that with the upcoming 6.x version of the
cookbook only versions >= 3.7.x of rabbitmq will be supported, which
isn't available as distro version at least for Ubuntu LTS releases yet.
So we change this pin into a soft match, allowing for updates within the
5.x stable branch, but blocking 6.x.

Change-Id: Id647f10fd5d4b69b441c4f8de8c325ec0032d9ea

commit_message:
Pinning postgres job to xenial

The postgres job is broken since a while.
Pinning the job to xenial to exclude possible issues with bionic.

commit_message:
taskflow: networkx needs pydot during taskflow's tests

however pydot is not a hard requirement for networkx and on SUSE
it is just a recommends which causes import failures during %check
phase.

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "taskflow/tests/unit/test_types.py", line 122, in test_pydot_output
    self.assertEqual(expected.lstrip(), g.export_to_dot())
  File "taskflow/types/graph.py", line 178, in export_to_dot
    return nx_pydot.to_pydot(self).to_string()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networkx/drawing/nx_pydot.py", line 199, in to_pydot
    pydot = _import_pydot()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networkx/drawing/nx_pydot.py", line 348, in _import_pydot
    import pydot
ImportError: No module named pydot

master had a fix in: I2bd46e8616d10f1dde32231ea0264626658eb115

Change-Id: Idf8bd343ac3e11897c6a4b060cff13d1e25515ea

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-20 19:01:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix swift reconfigure

Reconfiguring Swift currently fails to restart containers if
configuration changes. This is because kolla_set_configs is executed in
the containers as the default swift user, which does not have permission
to access all necessary files.

This change uses the root user to execute the command instead, which
allows it to exit with the correct status of 1 if the config files
differ.

Change-Id: I2a2363c71430a7173bb5253662412ae5dba09654
'}]
commit_message:
Fix swift reconfigure

Reconfiguring Swift currently fails to restart containers if
configuration changes. This is because kolla_set_configs is executed in
the containers as the default swift user, which does not have permission
to access all necessary files.

This change uses the root user to execute the command instead, which
allows it to exit with the correct status of 1 if the config files
differ.

Change-Id: I2a2363c71430a7173bb5253662412ae5dba09654

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-23 17:01:44.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add memoization to emulator connections

Drivers of Redfish emulator cache backend connections
for the duration of a single Redfish operation.

This change improves emulator responsiveness. However
it's still quite slow given that simple /Systems query
leads to multiple nova/glance API calls.

Change-Id: Ief46a0a7b82900ccf6d4c9ebb417f711a9b00513
"}, {'created': '2018-10-24 10:37:55.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add memoization to emulator connections

for the duration of a single Redfish operation.

This change improves emulator responsiveness. However
it's still quite slow given that simple /Systems query
leads to multiple nova/glance API calls.

Change-Id: Ief46a0a7b82900ccf6d4c9ebb417f711a9b00513
"}, {'created': '2018-10-24 10:50:36.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add memoization to emulator connections

Drivers of Redfish emulator cache backend connections
for the duration of a single Redfish operation.

This change improves emulator responsiveness. However
it's still quite slow given that simple /Systems query
leads to multiple nova/glance API calls.

Change-Id: Ief46a0a7b82900ccf6d4c9ebb417f711a9b00513
"}, {'created': '2018-10-24 10:55:59.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add memoization to emulator connections

Drivers of Redfish emulator now cache the
outcome of a select calls choosing either the
two policies:

* Cache the information for the lifetime of the
  emulator process if it's unlikely for such
  data to get out of sync
* Cache the more dynamic information just for
  the duration of a single Redfish REST API
  call

This change improves emulator responsiveness.

Change-Id: Ief46a0a7b82900ccf6d4c9ebb417f711a9b00513

commit_message:
Add memoization to expensive emulator calls

Drivers of Redfish emulator now cache the
outcome of a select calls choosing either the
two policies:

* Cache the information for the lifetime of the
  emulator process if it's unlikely for such
  data to get out of sync
* Cache the more dynamic information just for
  the duration of a single Redfish REST API
  call

This change improves emulator responsiveness.

Change-Id: Ief46a0a7b82900ccf6d4c9ebb417f711a9b00513

commit_message:
Fix broken Systems listing in dynamic emulator

The `.../Systems` resource libvirt handler uses a wrong way of
turning libvirt domain name into UUID. That results in emulator
crashing on resource access.

Change-Id: Ie10b236d171d84f9abe9a3446fd0b88f15ab2d08

commit_message:
Remove apache tls-proxy sites when stopping

Currently doing a cycle of

    ./stack.sh; ./unstack.sh; ./stack.sh

fails because the leftover tls-proxy sites will cause apache startup to
fail on the second stack.sh run. So we need to disable these sites on
running stop_tls_proxy.

Change-Id: I03e6879be332289d19ca6a656f5f9f139dffff6f
Closes-Bug: 1718189

commit_message:
Enable Rocky and python3

When the primary keystone is deployed with rocky and python3 the charm
fails to install the correct python3 packages and use the correct
clients.

Note: A related bug #1798184, will cause the tests to fail. A complete
Rocky python3 solution is dependent on #1798184 being resolved.

Change-Id: I42d8a5bfff3200d18e7bad0bd29edf12aa6a05c7
Closes-Bug: #1806111

commit_message:
Replacing Keystone deprecated configuration auth_uri with www_authenticate_uri

The auth_uri option is deprecated in favor of www_authenticate_uri and
will be removed in the Stien releasee and silently ignored in
the future. This change updates Keystone's auth_uri to
www_authenticate_uri in the security checklist docs.

Change-Id: I942db5fff874df20ce77b0f5741925e4cea8d859

[{'created': '2019-03-15 13:03:21.000000000', 'message': "Add new oc_hosts_roles variable.

With the new upgrades workflow we need to perform a more
granular upgrade node by node, instead of by role as we
were doing before. For that reason, we're adding a new
variable which contains all the hosts an ansible group
consists of. So we can iterate over them at the time of
upgrading.

Change-Id: I81f4add06218ad201d4772821723154c33d4123e
"}]
commit_message:
Add new oc_hosts_roles variable.

With the new upgrades workflow we need to perform a more
granular upgrade node by node, instead of by role as we
were doing before. For that reason, we're adding a new
variable which contains all the hosts an ansible group
consists of. So we can iterate over them at the time of
upgrading.

Change-Id: I81f4add06218ad201d4772821723154c33d4123e

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie4cb04ca9da0e7e93f0df0ddc14ba5314a3e91a7

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-20 22:36:39.000000000', 'message': "Don't register placement opts mutiple times in a test

The test_local_delete_removes_allocations_after_compute_restart test
was trying to register placement config opts 3 times when only once
is necessary, and if there are CLI opts being registered, only once is
allowed. With change I4cd3d637878eb5bb798b78fd73f5be99e141da9d in
placement, those opts gained some CLI opts, causing this test to
fail.

The depends-on is to a change in the placement-side PlacementFixture
to make it possible to not register opts when calling the fixture,
allowing the safe reuse of the already registered config.

Depends-On: I360a306b5d05ada75274733038b73ec2f2bdc4d4
Change-Id: I042e41ac8c41c0e5f0389904eb548e0e97d54c60
Closes-Bug: #1821092
"}]
commit_message:
Don't register placement opts mutiple times in a test

The test_local_delete_removes_allocations_after_compute_restart test
was trying to register placement config opts 3 times when only once
is necessary, and if there are CLI opts being registered, only once is
allowed. With change I4cd3d637878eb5bb798b78fd73f5be99e141da9d in
placement, those opts gained some CLI opts, causing this test to
fail.

The depends-on is to a change in the placement-side PlacementFixture
to make it possible to not register opts when calling the fixture,
allowing the safe reuse of the already registered config.

Depends-On: I360a306b5d05ada75274733038b73ec2f2bdc4d4
Change-Id: I042e41ac8c41c0e5f0389904eb548e0e97d54c60
Closes-Bug: #1821092

commit_message:
use proper dir for virtualhost config for ceilometer and placement api

Its currently using the conf-enabled dir for both of them, but that
directory is supposed to be used for confs only and they should be
soft links

Instead use the sites-available for those virtualhost definitions
and get also in sync with horizon, which is using the proper dir

Change-Id: I3c72f959e97be92cc1cf6a7269354d588e3dddd9

commit_message:
DNM DNM Fail container job if command failed

When script fails, the job continues and passes.  Remove
unnecessary code saving and let the task to fail.
Make script to be generated for easier investigation what
command was running.

Change-Id: I4049039fa478d7cf85ae7df3e8aeeb84521c750a

messages:
[{'account_id': 18955, 'date': '2019-03-06 11:01:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-03-06 16:34:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

As a cycle-with-rc deliverable, this should have an RC1 release candidate at that deadline, then any final updates before the official release at the end of the cycle.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-03-07 08:44:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> As a cycle-with-rc deliverable, this should have an RC1 release
 > candidate at that deadline, then any final updates before the
 > official release at the end of the cycle.

This one is hard to review, as there are so much things going on. It's hard to know if features were removed too. So I would suggest a X bump at least (X.y.z) and a pre-release first.

So basically agreeing with Sean here."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-03-17 21:45:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

As Sean says this should be 1.0.0rc1:

For future reference we have a tool called new-release[1,2] which can handle a lot of this for you:

 $ tools/new_release.sh --stable-branch stein tacker rc
   INFO: creating temporary files in /tmp/releases-dky91ugo
   INFO: going from ['0', '10', '0'] to 1.0.0.0rc1
   INFO: processing openstack/tacker
   INFO: advancing openstack/tacker from None (None) to d82541e50aad7058fea75ca6b6d26f18db9eb436
   INFO: adding stable branch at 1.0.0.0rc1




[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/src/branch/master/tools/new_release.sh
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/src/branch/master/openstack_releases/cmds/new_release.py [3]
[3] You probably need: https://review.openstack.org/643495 given this is your first release this cycle"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-03-21 09:52:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Actually it should be "1.0.0.0rc1" as 1.0.0rc1 is not a valid version number.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-03-21 09:54:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-03-21 09:54:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Pushing patch so that we have one ready to approve by RC deadline.
Dharmendra: please confirm that this is the right SHA for RC1.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-03-21 09:55:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hmm, actually this was superseded by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/644363/'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-03-21 09:55:36.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/644363/'}]

commit_message:
Upgrades: Don't try to publish ansible output in ceph_install

With new ansible the verbosity increased causing mistral to
choke up. We should not try to publish all the logs that are
already present in log file. This change is rocky and queens
only.

Change-Id: I76d8c622c156c173390c9cade31ea77c6d970cad
Resolves: rhbz#1687795
Closes-Bug: #1820996

subject: Import reverse from django.urls rather than django.core.urlresolvers
messages: [{'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-02-01 10:39:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-03-21 09:18:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-01 10:39:34.000000000', 'message': 'Import reverse from django.urls rather than django.core.urlresolvers

Starting with Django 2 (which is the python3 version), the reverse and
reverse_lazy functions are located in the django.urls module rather than
django.core.urlresolvers. In Django>=1.10 (horizon depends on 1.11), these
functions are available in django.urls. This commit aims at improving the
python3 compatibility.

Change-Id: I8e8d281c7cac21c4b5771d2430f7d376b7e8c46a
'}]
commit_message:
Import reverse from django.urls rather than django.core.urlresolvers

Starting with Django 2 (which is the python3 version), the reverse and
reverse_lazy functions are located in the django.urls module rather than
django.core.urlresolvers. In Django>=1.10 (horizon depends on 1.11), these
functions are available in django.urls. This commit aims at improving the
python3 compatibility.

Change-Id: I8e8d281c7cac21c4b5771d2430f7d376b7e8c46a

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ib1f2b96f606115c25d3a08a72054f060258ce856

commit_message:
Fix gnocchi collector metadata collection

This fixes metadata collection failures in the gnocchi collector caused
by resources having measures in periods where they are supposed to be deleted.
Metadata is now collected over a three-period window in the gnocchi collector.

Story: 2004895
Task: 29202
Change-Id: I52020cb44fc0adbcbe6228c507fe169f4b13b6e4

commit_message:
Update json module to jsonutils

oslo project provide jsonutils, and karborclient use it in many place[1],
this PS to update the remained json module to oslo jsonutils for
consistency.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/python-karborclient/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=jsonutils&type=

Change-Id: I8c2c0383eac12a5562f205640d6c8c7d062266b1

commit_message:
cmd: Extract methods to allow import from external

When methods for passwords generation and merge are
extracted then external apps and scripts can use
those methods without resolving to subprocess execution
or injecting sys.argv.

Change-Id: I99aff7852180534129fa36859075306eea776ba9
Signed-off-by: Maciej Kucia <maciej@kucia.net>

[{'created': '2019-03-20 14:49:42.000000000', 'message': 'Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie1fc6a0093c72e52033130deb8f34fd1e16d6a60
'}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie1fc6a0093c72e52033130deb8f34fd1e16d6a60

messages:
[{'account_id': 29503, 'date': '2018-12-19 10:35:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-12-19 11:16:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(9 comments)

Hi Justin, nice job!

Remarks and thoughts in the comments.

Two remarks: 

- Please use a positive tone
- Remove whitespaces'}, {'account_id': 29503, 'date': '2018-12-19 12:36:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks Luka,

I am currently updating the spec on your recommendations.

I would like to add that I am also for the removal of
the legacy option 'query' under 'extra_args'."}, {'account_id': 29503, 'date': '2018-12-19 12:53:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-12-19 13:05:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

Looks good! please remove the whitespaces and I'll +2"}, {'account_id': 29503, 'date': '2018-12-19 13:08:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 29503, 'date': '2018-12-19 14:43:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23173, 'date': '2018-12-19 15:32:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

thx for the spec. 

Just one remark'}, {'account_id': 29503, 'date': '2018-12-20 09:27:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi Maxime,

Thanks for the review,

Actually, the reworked collector will use PromQL,
encapsulated in HTTP queries, as it is the way to
interact with Prometheus in order to collect
metric data.

The main difference with the present state is that
the PromQL query to encapsulate will be built
inside the collector instead of being specified,
by hand, by the end user in the metrics.yml file.

I will detail the example as you requested though,
maybe it will make this point clearer.'}, {'account_id': 23173, 'date': '2018-12-20 10:41:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Yes, the idea is to have a complete example to understand where some configuration parameters are used like period, start and end timestamp, query_step, etc'}, {'account_id': 29503, 'date': '2019-01-30 13:44:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-01-30 15:21:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Hi Justin, thanks for the update! Looks good, only two remarks:
* Could you please use some "prometheus-style" metrics for your different examples ?
* There are some whitespaces

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 29503, 'date': '2019-01-31 14:04:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-01-31 14:36:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

LGTM, thanks.'}, {'account_id': 29503, 'date': '2019-02-15 09:07:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-03-21 08:46:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Enable Rocky and python3

When the primary keystone is deployed with rocky and python3 the charm
fails to install the correct python3 packages and use the correct
clients.

Note: A related bug #1798184, will cause the tests to fail. A complete
Rocky python3 solution is dependent on #1798184 being resolved.

Change-Id: I42d8a5bfff3200d18e7bad0bd29edf12aa6a05c7
Closes-Bug: #1806111

[{'created': '2019-03-13 15:57:53.000000000', 'message': "Add task to create volumes path in cephfs

If using the cephfs native backend, when container start the
manila-share process with the manila user, no permissions are
prompted when creating the volume.
One way to solve the problem is to create the volumes folder in
advance in cephfs and modify the owner and group to 42429:42429,
which is manila's uid and gid.

Change-Id: I1ad63e1c4698ec8ee83461aafefa63041cfeb387
Closes-Bug: #1761108
(cherry picked from commit 6bfc6d4f3ac15269830b820e3a3223c0b506ca2a)
"}]
commit_message:
Add task to create volumes path in cephfs

If using the cephfs native backend, when container start the
manila-share process with the manila user, no permissions are
prompted when creating the volume.
One way to solve the problem is to create the volumes folder in
advance in cephfs and modify the owner and group to 42429:42429,
which is manila's uid and gid.

Change-Id: I1ad63e1c4698ec8ee83461aafefa63041cfeb387
Closes-Bug: #1761108
(cherry picked from commit 6bfc6d4f3ac15269830b820e3a3223c0b506ca2a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-19 10:17:16.000000000', 'message': 'README: make it us-ascii

I may be wrong but with this change I can 'pip install' which should also
unbreak Kolla CI for Python 3 systems.

Without it:

()[root@c08bff4505c9 karbor]# pip install .
Processing /karbor-base-source/karbor-1.2.1.dev2
    Complete output from command python setup.py egg_info:
    ERROR:root:Error parsing
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/var/lib/kolla/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pbr/core.py", line 96, in pbr
        attrs = util.cfg_to_args(path, dist.script_args)
      File "/var/lib/kolla/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pbr/util.py", line 258, in cfg_to_args
        kwargs = setup_cfg_to_setup_kwargs(config, script_args)
      File "/var/lib/kolla/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pbr/util.py", line 322, in setup_cfg_to_setup_kwargs
        value += description_file.read().strip() + '\n\n'
      File "/var/lib/kolla/venv/lib/python3.6/encodings/ascii.py", line 27, in decode
        return codecs.ascii_decode(input, self.errors)[0]
    UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xe2 in position 1051: ordinal not in range(128)
    error in setup command: Error parsing /tmp/pip-req-build-pe1zf3cw/setup.cfg: UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xe2 in position 1051: ordinal not in range(128)

Change-Id: I3114b8e41b8362eb2ac7d6dca4753b09022e8016
'}, {'created': '2019-03-20 08:49:38.000000000', 'message': 'README: make it us-ascii

Karbor is not installable in Python 3 setup.

Closes-bug: 1820974
Change-Id: I3114b8e41b8362eb2ac7d6dca4753b09022e8016
'}]
commit_message:
README: make it us-ascii

Karbor is not installable in Python 3 setup.

Closes-bug: 1820974
Change-Id: I3114b8e41b8362eb2ac7d6dca4753b09022e8016

subject: Update json module to jsonutils
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-27 16:34:58.000000000', 'message': 'Update json module to jsonutils

oslo project provide jsonutils, and karbor use it in many place[1],
this PS to update the remained json module to oslo jsonutils for
consistency.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/karbor/search?q=jsonutils&unscoped_q=jsonutils

Change-Id: I8a191a0a668a05eb1a63bb6cf45eb2624a7f848a
'}]
commit_message:
Update json module to jsonutils

oslo project provide jsonutils, and karbor use it in many place[1],
this PS to update the remained json module to oslo jsonutils for
consistency.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/karbor/search?q=jsonutils&unscoped_q=jsonutils

Change-Id: I8a191a0a668a05eb1a63bb6cf45eb2624a7f848a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-07 11:59:05.000000000', 'message': 'make db-{drop,init) py3 compatible

They are using the old ConfigParser library which is lowercase under
py3, so try to import the correct one if the script are run under
py3

Change-Id: I4362f55933f7dfe2198da8e5d1aa1f33d3fb821e
'}]
commit_message:
make db-{drop,init) py3 compatible

They are using the old ConfigParser library which is lowercase under
py3, so try to import the correct one if the script are run under
py3

Change-Id: I4362f55933f7dfe2198da8e5d1aa1f33d3fb821e

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

'}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iec9ae34f9496baa3b522bc9ae2337bf7e3922ac0

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I96f2551277f98ee0e1cd6100846f503abe5a0edd

commit_message:
Remove unused and duplicate nodeset defined in Tempest

Below nodesets defined in Tempest are removed now:

- openstack-bionic-node This is unused after I5a24c697103090f6712d6e9168abe6c86f7c380c
- openstack-opensuse150-node is duplicate of devstack-single-node-opensuse-150

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/641746/

Change-Id: I39c03bfa52191a0b1acf6a73fa31b3c071ee60c1

rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: I70e1b71fbf099d053fb7b8c461131d09023ab11d
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Pass kwargs to exception to get better formatted error message

This is to pass kwargs to VolumeNotFound/ImageNotFound/
VolumeMappingNotFound/ContainerNotFound, and to fix kwargs for
QuotaResourceUnknown, to get better formatted error message.

Change-Id: If625c1c1a0ad159cf9a1d76de1d53448b3532b8c

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-21 03:08:34.000000000', 'message': 'Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Id12b2c62be0f6a86c7dd0dc11e03735308152c82
'}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Id12b2c62be0f6a86c7dd0dc11e03735308152c82

imported not in alphabetical order.

commit_message:
Revert "Centralize registration of logging options"

This reverts commit b647919666a451092189f963786e367d0baa82be.

It appears that this causes issues with cross project testing.

Related-Bug: #1821092

Change-Id: Ic612aed0651c083ee5f0396cba07a179324d158b

[{'created': '2019-02-26 14:23:16.000000000', 'message': "Fix AZ not matching backend after migration

When we migrate, or retype with migration, a volume between availability
zones we are setting the AZ of the migrated volume to the same AZ as the
source volume, so we end up with a volume where the AZ does not match
the backend's AZ.

This patch fixes this issue for the generic migration code as well as
the optimized driver migration.

Closes-Bug: #1747949
(cherry picked from commit fb8085894b69f56091bde19683a919cb15d502cc)

This patch fixes this issue for the generic migration code as well as

Change-Id: Ia1bf3ae0b7cd6d209354024848aef6029179d8e4
Closes-Bug: #1747949

commit_message:
Fix AZ not matching backend after migration

When we migrate, or retype with migration, a volume between availability
zones we are setting the AZ of the migrated volume to the same AZ as the
source volume, so we end up with a volume where the AZ does not match
the backend's AZ.

This patch fixes this issue for the generic migration code as well as
the optimized driver migration.

Change-Id: Ia1bf3ae0b7cd6d209354024848aef6029179d8e4
Closes-Bug: #1747949
(cherry picked from commit fb8085894b69f56091bde19683a919cb15d502cc)
(cherry picked from commit c2df706c023d752825c250c4ceb2f98f5ce5a476)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-05 21:27:36.000000000', 'message': "Make system members the same as system readers for credentials

It was decided some time ago that allowing system-members the ability
to do certain things that system-readers can't do, but not as much as
system-admins, isn't really all that helpful.

Unfortunately, the credential API was one of the first APIs we
migrated to formally adopting scope types and default roles. The
credential update policy was still allowing system-members to access
it, despite us deciding against it.

This commit updates the policy to be consistent with the patterns we
use for default roles across the rest of keystone's API.

Change-Id: If11ded59cb191a4d8bf531689b8827c3bfbb39fa
"}]
commit_message:
Make system members the same as system readers for credentials

It was decided some time ago that allowing system-members the ability
to do certain things that system-readers can't do, but not as much as
system-admins, isn't really all that helpful.

Unfortunately, the credential API was one of the first APIs we
migrated to formally adopting scope types and default roles. The
credential update policy was still allowing system-members to access
it, despite us deciding against it.

This commit updates the policy to be consistent with the patterns we
use for default roles across the rest of keystone's API.

Change-Id: If11ded59cb191a4d8bf531689b8827c3bfbb39fa

commit_message:
Pin to older grpc for ruby < 2.3

A new version of grpc was released which breaks our CI because we don't
have a newer ruby.

Remove the hardcoded dependency in this cherry pick.

Change-Id: Icb87ea9b4322f5eee97802970b4e215c2bbce8f7
Related-Bug: #1812105
(cherry picked from commit 799f976b7b7f31da2b3c474350d94b3000e60acd)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-20 20:47:30.000000000', 'message': 'Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3a511640f34f677f9c58c84c8d36966e7c18c829
'}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3a511640f34f677f9c58c84c8d36966e7c18c829

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: Iff38b88808fa21afeb00b22bd31a614a2f559a8f
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Implement domain member functionality for projects

This commit adds explicit testing for how users with the member role
on a domain should interact with projects both inside and outside of
the domain they have authorization on.

Subsequent patches will continue to build on this by incorporating:

 - domain admin functionality
 - project user test coverage

Change-Id: Ic0fe47b7a578270ef4a5e579ac64db63337956c6
Related-Bug: 1750660
