commit_message:
Implement domain reader functionality for projects

This commit adds explicit testing for how users with the reader role
on a domain should interact with projects both inside and outside of
the domain they have authorization on.

Subsequent patches will continue to build on this by incorporating:

 - domain member test coverage
 - domain admin functionality
 - project user test coverage

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/642102/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/624794/
Change-Id: I28db6b9bdb16a1ecdacdc2b9ecbb8674ef4d8fe4
Related-Bug: 1750660
Related-Bug: 1806762

subject: Make it possible to opt out of nested transactions
messages:
[{'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-03-13 21:35:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-03-13 21:36:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

A gift to you, Lucas, since I know you kind of hate the nested transactions. :D This should make it much easier for networking-ovn to opt out of them if they want.'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2019-03-14 07:36:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2019-03-14 08:11:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> A gift to you, Lucas, since I know you kind of hate the nested
 > transactions. :D

:'-("}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-03-14 12:19:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-03-14 12:24:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > A gift to you, Lucas, since I know you kind of hate the nested
 > > transactions. :D
 > 
 > :'-(

I think the part he hates is the part that is my fault/ovsdb's fault. We fixed part of the issue with ReadOnly commands that will pass through their return values w/o creating an actual transaction. But things like add/create that return UUIDs from the actual commit() can't possibly get their values to use in a nested transaction. (python-ovs actually does this with a temporary uuid/row for use in in-transaction). We'd have to do some reworking to find a way to make that work with ovsdbapp's model."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-03-14 13:59:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

yayyyyyy thanks :D'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2019-03-15 09:17:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-13 21:35:11.000000000', 'message': "Make it possible to opt out of nested transactions

Nested transactions work for simple things, but intermediate
results from transaction commands like create/add that are used
in subsequent nested transactions won't exist until the the end of
the whole nested transaction, causing failures. Since this can be
surprising, make it possible to easily opt out on a per-transaction
or per-API basis.

Change-Id: I4f7997d5dc11a190e188c16e8eac9fe5df8b0d0d
"}, {'created': '2019-03-15 15:02:35.000000000', 'message': "Make it possible to opt out of nested transactions

Nested transactions work for simple things, but intermediate
results from transaction commands like create/add that are used
in subsequent nested transactions won't exist until the the end of
the whole nested transaction, causing failures. Since this can be
surprising, make it possible to easily opt out on a per-transaction
or per-API basis.

Change-Id: I4f7997d5dc11a190e188c16e8eac9fe5df8b0d0d
"}, {'created': '2019-03-19 12:49:11.000000000', 'message': "Make it possible to opt out of nested transactions

Nested transactions work for simple things, but intermediate
results from transaction commands like create/add that are used
in subsequent nested transactions won't exist until the the end of
the whole nested transaction, causing failures. Since this can be
surprising, make it possible to easily opt out on a per-transaction
or per-API basis.

Change-Id: I4f7997d5dc11a190e188c16e8eac9fe5df8b0d0d
"}]
commit_message:
Make it possible to opt out of nested transactions

Nested transactions work for simple things, but intermediate
results from transaction commands like create/add that are used
in subsequent nested transactions won't exist until the the end of
the whole nested transaction, causing failures. Since this can be
surprising, make it possible to easily opt out on a per-transaction
or per-API basis.

Change-Id: I4f7997d5dc11a190e188c16e8eac9fe5df8b0d0d

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-18 14:56:44.000000000', 'message': 'Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I85cfdb712f12ec5e16c33a6017b17cf01428dbfb
'}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I85cfdb712f12ec5e16c33a6017b17cf01428dbfb

[{'created': '2019-01-29 08:06:23.000000000', 'message': "Prevent the delete floating IP API from deleting reserved floating ips

If a floating IP is reserved by any reservations, the delete floating
IP API shouldn't delete the floating IP.

This patch changes the delete floating IP API to check allocations
associated to the floating IP, then if there're allocation the API
doesn't delete the floating IP.

commit_message:
Prevent the delete floating IP API from deleting reserved floating ips

If a floating IP is reserved by any reservations, the delete floating
IP API shouldn't delete the floating IP.

This patch changes the delete floating IP API to check allocations
associated to the floating IP, then if there is any allocation the API
doesn't delete the floating IP.

Partially Implements: blueprint floatingip-reservation
Change-Id: I0c48eaa4084ea65b658cb568358b4c9bcf5178f2

subject: Verify client input for v4 signatures
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-01-08 19:55:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-03-19 18:54:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(4 comments)

seems like a well written and straight forward improvement.

I think verifying these signatures is great.  More secure and correct.  Well done.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-03-19 21:43:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-03-20 17:19:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-08 19:55:05.000000000', 'message': "Verify client input for v4 signatures

Previously, we would use the X-Amz-Content-SHA256 value when calculating
signatures, but wouldn't actually check the content that was sent. This
would allow a malicious third party that managed to capture the headers
for an object upload to overwrite that with arbitrary content provided
they could do so within the 5-minute clock-skew window.

Now, we wrap the wsgi.input that's sent on to the proxy-server app to
hash content as it's read and raise an error if there's a mismatch. Note
that clients using presigned-urls to upload have no defense against a
similar replay attack.

Notwithstanding the above security consideration, this *also* provides
better assurances that the client's payload was received correctly. Note
that this *does not* attempt to send an etag in footers, however, so the
proxy-to-object-server connection is not guarded against bit-flips.

In the future, Swift will hopefully grow a way to perform SHA256
verification on the object-server. This would offer two main benefits:

  - End-to-end message integrity checking.
  - Move CPU load of calculating the hash from the proxy (which is
    somewhat CPU-bound) to the object-server (which tends to have CPU to
    spare).

Change-Id: I61eb12455c37376be4d739eee55a5f439216f0e9
Closes-Bug: 1765834
"}]
commit_message:
Verify client input for v4 signatures

Previously, we would use the X-Amz-Content-SHA256 value when calculating
signatures, but wouldn't actually check the content that was sent. This
would allow a malicious third party that managed to capture the headers
for an object upload to overwrite that with arbitrary content provided
they could do so within the 5-minute clock-skew window.

Now, we wrap the wsgi.input that's sent on to the proxy-server app to
hash content as it's read and raise an error if there's a mismatch. Note
that clients using presigned-urls to upload have no defense against a
similar replay attack.

Notwithstanding the above security consideration, this *also* provides
better assurances that the client's payload was received correctly. Note
that this *does not* attempt to send an etag in footers, however, so the
proxy-to-object-server connection is not guarded against bit-flips.

In the future, Swift will hopefully grow a way to perform SHA256
verification on the object-server. This would offer two main benefits:

  - End-to-end message integrity checking.
  - Move CPU load of calculating the hash from the proxy (which is
    somewhat CPU-bound) to the object-server (which tends to have CPU to
    spare).

Change-Id: I61eb12455c37376be4d739eee55a5f439216f0e9
Closes-Bug: 1765834

commit_message:
Destroy type quotas when a share type is deleted

Upon share type deletion, we were leaving behind
share type quotas, usages and reservations. These
couldn't be cleaned up without resorting to manual
intervention.

Cleanup quotas when a share type is being destroyed,
since the resources that they pertained to are gone
too.

Closes-Bug: #1811680
Change-Id: I04b1fe88808596aa8c05429b964190d654587f9a
(cherry picked from commit 4b6cfcf69023dc7a4b004c59513c50d92b979152)
(cherry picked from commit aae7bc723591728c6be2a500ca44af8e6a032268)
(cherry picked from commit c9f954119391770899a68372bb0bd2829fc9b3c2)

commit_message:
Fix driver filter to not check share_backend_name

Fixed the bug stating: Driver filter disallows using
queries with share_backend_name. The driver filter was
checking for hard equality between the share_backend_name
specified in the share type and the name reported by the
host [1]. This defeats the purpose of the capabilities
filter giving the ability to use "<in>" (selection)
operator in the extra-spec. Thus this commit fixes it by
updating the required files according to
openstack/cinder/commit/b32011 as now the driver does not
check for shared_backend_name.

Closes-Bug: #1815700

Change-Id: If384392d0f140922bb85a1dc50b0c4494c231e2f
(cherry picked from commit 86c1576110f9e6d92ea539c2a2b16f46d325f6ee)
(cherry picked from commit ce370a1892ed5e1820d55008acb2e87abc7b9db8)
(cherry picked from commit c75d48c067875609f5e0dcc1c8f6896f55af9fbd)

[{'created': '2019-03-14 17:06:03.000000000', 'message': "'iscsiadm -m session' failure handling

Sometimes 'iscsiadm -m session' outputs warnings on stderr, but
still serves its purpose (usable stdout). We should not give up on
it when stderr is non-empty - instead, rely on the exit status, log
the stderr as a warning, and move on.

This change also removes 1 (ISCSI_ERR) from the list of acceptable
exit codes for the iscsiadm command, to ensure that failures get
caught.

Change-Id: Id8183cf3d8baf2f8ba6a00a47fa2ad7cc2a96aa5
Closes-Bug: #1732199
(cherry picked from commit d398fa82334bbabbc4c7d5b8f1fe5a7a4465200e)
"}]
commit_message:
'iscsiadm -m session' failure handling

Sometimes 'iscsiadm -m session' outputs warnings on stderr, but
still serves its purpose (usable stdout). We should not give up on
it when stderr is non-empty - instead, rely on the exit status, log
the stderr as a warning, and move on.

This change also removes 1 (ISCSI_ERR) from the list of acceptable
exit codes for the iscsiadm command, to ensure that failures get
caught.

Change-Id: Id8183cf3d8baf2f8ba6a00a47fa2ad7cc2a96aa5
Closes-Bug: #1732199
(cherry picked from commit d398fa82334bbabbc4c7d5b8f1fe5a7a4465200e)

"}, {'created': '2019-03-20 12:26:28.000000000', 'message': "Fix broken dragonflow gates

This commit is composed of 4 (four) commits that fix various aspects
that were broken in the gate.

Co-Authored-By: Omer Anson <omer.anson@toganetworks.com>

Bump up the version of libzmq for Ubuntu and Suse

This is required as libzmq1 is no longer supported under these
platforms.

Change-Id: I17c73025856c006926ea6b2444c4fde86726db9d

Install ruby via the operating system

As opposed to installing it from source, success of which is a matter of
chance.

Change-Id: I39f13525d9b1d814c90ac898148b9543ed64cd7e

Cleanup registered apps with os-ken

Otherwise, os-ken complains that the apps are already
instantiated. This might be causing the get failure.

Disable test TestNeighborAdvertiser

It isn't working. Reported in bug 1820977.

Change-Id: Ie1f9c05c3847320ba1892c52182d3e7d856f4957
Related-Bug: #1820977
"}]
commit_message:
Fix broken dragonflow gates

This commit is composed of 4 (four) commits that fix various aspects
that were broken in the gate.

Co-Authored-By: Omer Anson <omer.anson@toganetworks.com>

Bump up the version of libzmq for Ubuntu and Suse

This is required as libzmq1 is no longer supported under these
platforms.

Change-Id: I17c73025856c006926ea6b2444c4fde86726db9d

Install ruby via the operating system

As opposed to installing it from source, success of which is a matter of
chance.

Change-Id: I39f13525d9b1d814c90ac898148b9543ed64cd7e

Cleanup registered apps with os-ken

Otherwise, os-ken complains that the apps are already
instantiated. This might be causing the get failure.

Change-Id: Iad8f76aafe98be443b0efa34e2f9cef8f40a9588

Disable test TestNeighborAdvertiser

It isn't working. Reported in bug 1820977.

Change-Id: Ie1f9c05c3847320ba1892c52182d3e7d856f4957
Related-Bug: #1820977

and floatingip_allocations tables

[{'created': '2019-02-27 19:49:53.000000000', 'message': 'Restore PowerMax unit test mock

Commit If6f7c58f445dd813df7161cc6cd6dd84484e8a7e appears to have
inadvertently removed a mock of get_max_over_subscription_ratio from one
of the test suites. This still passed apparently due to timing of other
test runs also mocking this call, but if tests happen to run in a
differnt order, or if these specific tests are run by themselves, it
results in the error:

TypeError: float() argument must be a string or a number

This restores the mock to match the other tests. These should probably
be refactored to not need this in each one, but this will at least
prevent failures for now and get back to how it had been in prior to the
mentioned change.

Conflicts (due to rebranding):
    cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/dell_emc/vmax/test_vmax.py

Change-Id: Iebcc8d8cd9bd39dbde64fef194b262ff7b12e5b6
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit ec8b8e2a3fb5cf7b947fbe31542493e2c7ebb764)

commit_message:
Restore VMAX unit test mock

Commit If6f7c58f445dd813df7161cc6cd6dd84484e8a7e appears to have
inadvertently removed a mock of get_max_over_subscription_ratio from one
of the test suites. This still passed apparently due to timing of other
test runs also mocking this call, but if tests happen to run in a
differnt order, or if these specific tests are run by themselves, it
results in the error:

TypeError: float() argument must be a string or a number

This restores the mock to match the other tests. These should probably
be refactored to not need this in each one, but this will at least
prevent failures for now and get back to how it had been in prior to the
mentioned change.

Conflicts (due to rebranding):
    cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/dell_emc/vmax/test_vmax.py

Change-Id: Iebcc8d8cd9bd39dbde64fef194b262ff7b12e5b6
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit ec8b8e2a3fb5cf7b947fbe31542493e2c7ebb764)

commit_message:
Add floatingip plugin to support floating IP resource

To support floating IP reservation, this patch adds the floatingip
plugin. As first step to the goal, the plugin supports create, get
and delete floatingip resource.

Partially Implements: blueprint floatingip-reservation
Change-Id: I271cfa4b4ad685c7095fa5ef4ac6721a86a5b07a

commit_message:
Parameterize undercloud masquerade networks overrides

hieradata-overrides-t-h-t-undercloud.yaml had the OVB
undercloud networks hardcoded. These values will not work
for baremetal systems.

This review parameterizes the network values to allow
baremetal envs to use suitable networks.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/643140
Change-Id: I001102bfa5a2739655be81808655bc751b25cf42

 >

Xubo, a test here https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py#L2551-L2554 can modified to test the ext_dvr_bridge_exits function like this

-        agent._process_router_if_compatible(router)
-        self.assertIn(router['id'], agent.router_info)
-        self.plugin_api.get_external_network_id.assert_called_with(
-            agent.context)
+       with mock.patch.object(l3router.RouterInfo,
+                               'external_bridge_exists') as ext_br:
+            agent._process_router_if_compatible(router)
+            self.assertIn(router['id'], agent.router_info)
+           
           self.plugin_api.get_external_network_id.assert_called_with(
+                agent.context)
+            ext_br.assert_called_once_with('br-ex')"}, {'account_id': 28059, 'date': '2018-07-23 20:48:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-07-24 00:35:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- neutron-tempest-iptables_hybrid: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1686542
- neutron-tempest-linuxbridge: unrecognized error
- neutron-tempest-plugin-scenario-linuxbridge: unrecognized error
- openstack-tox-cover: unrecognized error
- openstack-tox-lower-constraints: unrecognized error
- openstack-tox-py27: unrecognized error
- openstack-tox-py35: unrecognized error

Some of the tests failed in a way that we did not understand. Please help us classify these issues so that they can be part of Elastic Recheck http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/

- openstack-tox-pep8: unrecognized error
- openstack-tox-py27: unrecognized error
- openstack-tox-py35: unrecognized error
- openstack-tox-py36: unrecognized error
- tempest-full-py3: unrecognized error
- tempest-full: unrecognized error

Some of the tests failed in a way that we did not understand. Please help us classify these issues so that they can be part of Elastic Recheck http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-10-17 20:57:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

Xubo,

I suggest you start debugging the unit tests. Follow these steps:

1) click on openstack-tox-py27 under the Zuul check section. You should land here: http://logs.openstack.org/36/528336/15/check/openstack-tox-py27/20b5f44/. 

2) Click on job-output.txt.gz. Scroll down until you get here: http://logs.openstack.org/36/528336/15/check/openstack-tox-py27/20b5f44/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-10-05_18_36_21_222085

3) There you can see the test cases that failed. In this patch you had 231 failures. The number seems daunting, but if you scroll down, you will see that there are a few common errors to all of them. One example is 'TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'interface_driver''. If you fix this for one of the tests, you are going to fix a lot of test cases at the same time. What did you do in your patch that might be causing this problem? Please note, that for each failed test case, you get a treceback that shows you the excat line where the failure occurred (the one at the bottom of each traceback). If you work you way up the traceback, you can see who called the method that failed and so on. 

4) If you need to debug manually any of the tests in your local environment, run one of them as follows (I am just picking the first failure in the log in this example):

$ tox -e py27 neutron.tests.unit.agent.l3.extensions.qos.test_fip.FipQosExtensionTestCase.test_add_router_only_egress

This first run is to make sure your virtual environment is created. Now to run it with debugger, you edit the test case and add the following line where you want to set a break in the code:

import pdb; pdb.set_trace()

and the type the following commands:

$ . .tox/py27/bin/activate # this only had to be typed once in a debugging session

$ python -m testtools.run neutron.tests.unit.agent.l3.extensions.qos.test_fip.FipQosExtensionTestCase.test_add_router_only_egress


Once you are done debugging you can abandon the testing virtual environment by typing:

$ deactivate

Let me know if this helps"}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-10-17 21:00:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

You can get more information on Neutron tests here: https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/contributor/testing/index.html'}, {'account_id': 28059, 'date': '2018-10-23 01:22:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-10-23 02:56:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

commit_message:
L3 agent refactor patch

This patch creates an abstract class (RouterInfoBase) to define the
requirements for an implementation to communicate with the L3 agent.

The only implementation as of this patch is the one we already know,
powered by the Linux kernel IP stack and iptables, in RouterInfo class.

Related-Bug: #1705536

Co-Authored-By: Xubo Zhang <xubo.zhang@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Igor D.C. <igor.duarte.cardoso@intel.com>

Change-Id: Ic75c2a054d622127376223152443952fd44bcff8

commit_message:
Enable to refresh ngdetails view

For now, refreshing ngdetails view by browser using F5 key or reload
button, it causes 404 error from django. To fix this issue, this patch
adds the url for '/ngdetails' into django.

To reproduce navigations, each request for views.py requires
'dashboard' and 'panel' object. Otherwise django side returns
500 error.

However the URL for request of details page (i.e. /ngdetails/)
can not provide informations to set the proper navigation.

So this patch set them to default dashboard and default panel.

This patch focuses to prevent 500 error. So the issue for
settings of proper navigation will be fixed by subsequent patch.

Change-Id: Ib9f1fe48b3cdecff5ad56e68a5ba58a41cb35f38
Closes-Bug: #1681627
(cherry picked from commit 077163a03c9aea08efd56251e49d69eb1cc4d093)
(cherry picked from commit a0fc40b4e85d3090e657cca9824de719b33a7ba2)
Signed-off-by: Zhang Hua <joshua.zhang@canonical.com>

It can happen that the _ds_manager is temporarily unreachable
due service not ready or network issues. In these cases,

commit_message:
Return 503 rather than 500 error when _ds_manager unreachable

It can happen that the _ds_manager is temporarily unreachable
due service not ready or network issues. In these cases,
the patch makes sure the API returns 503 http status code
instead of 500, so that the client knows the issue is
temporary.

Change-Id: I8a03a2e0ac84c2395b5ea2015647c5c7d2fed03e
Closes-bug: 1811754

commit_message:
Fix error when keywords are defined as a list in cfg

When keywords are defined as a list in cfg file the generated
output have errors and breaks metadata generation.

Change-Id: Ie8a5f30d6af1e81ecf3ca40bc94bc460cca38179
Closes-Bug: #1811475

commit_message:
Don't translate event reason when adding hook event

We don't seem to do it anywhere else. TripleO uses hook
reason string comparsion which does not work if
internationalized.

Story: #2005035
Task: 29524
Change-Id: I3e8f4587966969084cbf1e38406cd3cff23eb9a6
(cherry picked from commit 1cd8ce37c038ed79371da60527de35bb75bdfab5)

commit_message:
Drop redundant rpms from nova-base package list

- openstack-base explictly pulls in python[3]-keystoneclient
- openstack-base pulls in python[3]-openstackclient which
  pulls in python[3]-cinderclient

This simplifies the python2/3 cases, and reduces how many
times these 2 packages are installed

Change-Id: If8eb4dc1c5d5de88a8d9b59920b01d09cb585ebb

commit_message:
WIP: Expose enforcement API outside of ctx manager

The motivation for this patch came out of a discussion with the nova
team about consuming and enforcing limits without requiring the usage
of a context manager. This is because some services might be doing
the verification check for race conditions in another process, making
the usage of a context manager awkward.

This commit attempts to whiteboard an approach where only a single
method is exposed for the service to consume.

Change-Id: I6ed4273446082d745c1fa3a2d30583c9eed21af4
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/615602/

commit_message:
Allow ProjectClaims to support multiple resources

In discussing with other projects about typical usage
calculation, it became apparent that supporting multiple
resources in a single claim is an important requirement.

This commit modifies the ProjectClaim API in backwards incompatible
ways so that users can associate multiple resources to a single
claim. Since this library is still technically unreleased and less
than version 1.0, backwards incompatible changes are acceptable.

Change-Id: Ib0b1ec34b0e82e4439e53f1992c37d8b2f99fb04
Closes-Bug: 1790931

commit_message:
Rename callback to usage_callback

It's very likely that we'll be adding other callbacks to the Enforcer
object for cleanup operations. This commit renames the current
callback to be specific to usage.

Change-Id: I8750ebdfd9bbeb89490c030f68b9d4d588679e3f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-23 12:58:26.000000000', 'message': "Handle KeyError for user options gracefully

Several reports have been filed when upgrading to Ocata where
keystone emits a KeyError because a user's reference doesn't contain
an `options` key. This is due to a refactor that landed during the
Ocata release that added `options` to user entities through a schema
migration and the authentication code expects the attribute to be
there. The original implementation didn't account for cached users
during the upgrade process, which will cause issues since cached user
references won't contain the required `options` key.

A workaround that operators have been doing is to manually flush
the entire cache at various points during the database migration. This
is inefficient because it invalidates all regions, instead of just
the affected user region. This commit adds a specific try/except to
handle KeyErrors gracefully by invalidating the cache and asking the
identity backend for the user reference again, which should result in
a cache miss and allow the identity backend to populate the options
attribute normally.

Change-Id: Ie806375ce9872c9efdb21e18a93d22990d5170c5
Closes-Bug: 1793389
"}]
commit_message:
Handle KeyError for user options gracefully

Several reports have been filed when upgrading to Ocata where
keystone emits a KeyError because a user's reference doesn't contain
an `options` key. This is due to a refactor that landed during the
Ocata release that added `options` to user entities through a schema
migration and the authentication code expects the attribute to be
there. The original implementation didn't account for cached users
during the upgrade process, which will cause issues since cached user
references won't contain the required `options` key.

A workaround that operators have been doing is to manually flush
the entire cache at various points during the database migration. This
is inefficient because it invalidates all regions, instead of just
the affected user region. This commit adds a specific try/except to
handle KeyErrors gracefully by invalidating the cache and asking the
identity backend for the user reference again, which should result in
a cache miss and allow the identity backend to populate the options
attribute normally.

Change-Id: Ie806375ce9872c9efdb21e18a93d22990d5170c5
Closes-Bug: 1793389

An unscoped token, or even the original authentication call would be a safer limitation.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2019-03-20 20:45:11.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I've had this on the back burner for a while. Removing this from my work queue until we're sure we can do this or decide to pick it back up.

FWIW - I still really like the idea."}]

commit_message:
Add specification for a capabilities API

Now that policy is in code, we have a way to cleanly expose
permissions to users based on their role assignments.

bp capabilities

Change-Id: Ib3a0af09a006630f111302e286acdf043c6de71e

commit_message:
WIP: experiment with oslo.limit interface

We're currently trying to figure out what the interface should be in
oslo.limit that allows for easy consumption. This commit attempts a
alternative route to enforcing limits using oslo.limit and unified
limits in keystone.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/615643/
Change-Id: Idb7856e951dbaedd9076f5d90ba408796f9e4907

commit_message:
placement release for stein rc1

Also the location of bugs has been moved to storyboard and
the team to placement (as those are now the truth).

In order to overcome validation checks, the previous stand-in
0.1.0 release needs to be removed. The package is still out
there, but we don't need to track it here. (Idea via
smcginnis)

Change-Id: I97207f286cf80274f4b9d6b4ab4d17275252d6fb

commit_message:
Use application_url in API version document

this handles the possible vhost in Heat API path correctly
(like http://mucloud.com/heat-api) contrary to host_url.

Change-Id: I2f4dbb7d98fbdf5314d5771309919c5b25a72f94
Story: 2002531
Task: 22075
(cherry picked from commit b2fa516a47c2278238df92ef9d7846decdce98e0)

Argh, cinder is still not published to pypi? ;( Then this is fine...'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-03-15 09:52:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

https://pypi.org/project/cinder/13.0.3/ is published - so, use that one.

For building, Zuul will checkout git version - this allows depends-on to work, so no need to pass in git which would ignore depends-on.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-03-15 10:09:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

@Andreas, thank you for the quick review.
Cinderlib is a "weird" project, because it's a library but uses the Cinder project as if it were a library, and it's tightly couple to it, so we want to use master instead of PyPi in the gates.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-03-15 10:25:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

you do use master in the gate if you follow my recommendation - thanks to tox-siblings. This means you aslo need to add cinder as required-project everywhere to have it checked out.

This will allow you to use depends-on and work without further changes on branches as well.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-03-15 12:19:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-03-15 12:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Andreas, I have followed your recommendations to add it to required-projects, but I think we should keep the git repos in the tox file so local development also uses master.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-03-15 12:30:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Gorka, check how this is done for other repos...

Having both might not do what you want ;)'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-03-18 14:00:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@Andreas: Apparently it's worse that not doing what I want, it seems like Zuul doesn't run the jobs, or they don't report results: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/643628/1

I'll change the tox file to not use the other repos and see if the cross-project dependency works."}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-03-18 14:03:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

On second thought... maybe it didn't run the tests because there was no code changes on the test patch...  I'll try that first."}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-03-18 17:04:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I can now confirm that this configuration results in using the code we want:

- Local installs cinder and os-brick from master

- Cinderlib jobs use master:
  * Zuul Configuration: http://logs.openstack.org/14/643014/6/check/cinderlib-lvm-functional/4299c34/zuul-info/inventory.yaml
  * Checkout of master: http://logs.openstack.org/14/643014/6/check/cinderlib-lvm-functional/4299c34/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-03-15_15_51_42_695877
  * Installation: http://logs.openstack.org/14/643014/6/check/cinderlib-lvm-functional/4299c34/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-03-15_15_57_45_244011

- Cross-repo dependencies work as expected -  Example with os-brick:
  * Zuul Configuration: http://logs.openstack.org/28/643628/3/check/cinderlib-lvm-functional/02c6fed/zuul-info/inventory.yaml
       change: '643421'
       change_url: https://review.openstack.org/643421
       patchset: '2'
  * Checkout of the branch: http://logs.openstack.org/28/643628/3/check/cinderlib-lvm-functional/02c6fed/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-03-18_16_20_42_886897
  * Installation: http://logs.openstack.org/28/643628/3/check/cinderlib-lvm-functional/02c6fed/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-03-18_16_26_51_441582"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-03-20 16:20:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Review-Priority+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-03-20 17:05:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

This looks fine to me. Wondering if we should just clean up the README instead of adding the description file, but that works.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-03-20 18:49:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

'}, {'created': '2019-03-15 12:19:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fix cinderlib Python package

Setuptools gives 2 errors with the current cinderlib Python package:

- Project's description-file has an unsupported directive.
- test-requirements has a github reference.

We fix the first issue by removing the git repository from the test
requirements and adding it to the Tox file while adding cinder to the
required-projects to allow cross-repo denedencies.

We also add os-brick since we are currently also very dependent on it on
the nos_brick.py code.

For the second issue we create a new DESCRIPTION.rst file that doesn't
include the "raw" directive unsupported by PyPi.

This patch will allow us to add the publish-to-pypi job to the
project-config repository.

Required-By: I9d8d9f7d802a27c3bfe3dbc0ee84cc24eee24ebc
Change-Id: Id029cedef513753700a10bcae761fdc1807964e1
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cinderlib Python package

Setuptools gives 2 errors with the current cinderlib Python package:

- Project's description-file has an unsupported directive.
- test-requirements has a github reference.

We fix the first issue by removing the git repository from the test
requirements and adding it to the Tox file while adding cinder to the
required-projects to allow cross-repo denedencies.

We also add os-brick since we are currently also very dependent on it on
the nos_brick.py code.

For the second issue we create a new DESCRIPTION.rst file that doesn't
include the "raw" directive unsupported by PyPi.

This patch will allow us to add the publish-to-pypi job to the
project-config repository.

Required-By: I9d8d9f7d802a27c3bfe3dbc0ee84cc24eee24ebc
Change-Id: Id029cedef513753700a10bcae761fdc1807964e1

commit_message:
Only run the needed services for CephFS jobs

These jobs often fail due to timeouts so only enable the services
required for devstack tests with these back ends.

Change-Id: Ib620ec3c2a9999ea9908a7c23aa7172c40a4cbd9
(cherry picked from commit f096d1145c7b14fae2c666b8d088574e570bffd4)

(cherry picked from commit 13f121ad2044a2f553c7eb30beb28741bca2ad7e)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: I19a99c5cad325530ca167eea83a88f9e7eab16a1
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Drop run_tests.sh and tools/colorizer.py

The CI is not using run_tests.sh so I assume people do not use it
either.
tools/colorizer.py is only used by run_tests.sh so remove this as
well.

Change-Id: I498943725f2635918141c1b02a5419e7eb90bd36

commit_message:
Switch devstack plugin to samltest.id

testshib.org is no longer maintained and has been broken for some
time[1]. Use the new samltest.id provider instead.

This is not a permanent solution, this is a stopgap measure until we
configure our own IdP in the devstack plugin.

[1] https://marc.info/?l=shibboleth-users&m=154056288800549&w=2

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/643599

Change-Id: Ifa514395d9cdb2197ef8a43885ec598483dd7a38
(cherry picked from commit e4fe2659c46b5e11adcc193945d311c0337ce982)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-20 17:10:40.000000000', 'message': "Elasticsearch: Remove insertion of test data in helm tests

This removes the insertion of test dummy data and the following
query for it from the Elasticsearch helm tests.  Upon upgrades,
it's possible for Elasticsearch to refuse the direct insertion of
data due to shard reallocation and due to full bulk endpoint
queues. These refusals should not be seen as test failures

Change-Id: Id53d53a7aa2b58e64932d50ca3e7a4fb1141bb3a
"}]
commit_message:
Elasticsearch: Remove insertion of test data in helm tests

This removes the insertion of test dummy data and the following
query for it from the Elasticsearch helm tests.  Upon upgrades,
it's possible for Elasticsearch to refuse the direct insertion of
data due to shard reallocation and due to full bulk endpoint
queues. These refusals should not be seen as test failures

Change-Id: Id53d53a7aa2b58e64932d50ca3e7a4fb1141bb3a

[{'account_id': 29974, 'date': '2019-02-22 16:27:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-02-22 16:28:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2019-02-22 23:02:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-22 16:27:48.000000000', 'message': 'Moves the checkPGs cron job from ceph-mon to ceph-client

The checkPGs cron job was previously deployed as part of the
ceph-mon chart, which was probably premature. This change moves
that deployment to the ceph-client chart so things are in a more
complete state by the time the job runs.

Change-Id: I9855d8d22265e78c7e2f5fa7ece69c9ff532ecb2

commit_message:
Move ceph-mon's checkPGs cron job to ceph-client

- Move the cronjob from ceph-mon to ceph-client
- Adding ceph-rbd-pool job as dependencies for cronjob
- checkPGs manifest set to true so it will always run
in gate.

Co-Authored-By: Chinasubbareddy Mallavarapu <cr3938@att.com>,
                Renis Makadia <renis.makadia@att.com>

Change-Id: I9855d8d22265e78c7e2f5fa7ece69c9ff532ecb2

[{'created': '2019-02-04 15:21:21.000000000', 'message': 'Readiness probe for Neutron SRIOV agent

Implements Readiness probe for neutron-sriov-agent pod. The logic on
lines of readiness probe of neutron-ovs-agent chart is to check the
if neutron-sriov-agent container can see configured physical NICs and
also if the VFs are properly configured for those.

List of confgiured physical NICs in read from sriov_agent.ini file.

Change-Id: Id1cca74be51f189e684e2599d0b7abcea281d36e
'}]
commit_message:
Readiness probe for Neutron SRIOV agent

Implements Readiness probe for neutron-sriov-agent pod. The logic on
lines of readiness probe of neutron-ovs-agent chart is to check the
if neutron-sriov-agent container can see configured physical NICs and
also if the VFs are properly configured for those.

List of confgiured physical NICs in read from sriov_agent.ini file.

Change-Id: Id1cca74be51f189e684e2599d0b7abcea281d36e

[{'created': '2019-02-27 17:34:00.000000000', 'message': 'VMware: Fix revert-to-snapshot

Commit 46b8da35d79121df34ec9befd353c8c428be846b modified
the method we use to query the backend volumes. But,
revert-to-snapshot implementation which was in-progress
when the above commit was merged missed that change.
Fixing it by updating the query method call in
revert_to_snapshot.

Change-Id: I34cbd4420b43f52cd8d23833658f6386cb3e6437
Closes-bug: #1790008
(cherry picked from commit 258beef2649d79c24ddafaf2064e94557c316bde)
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: Fix revert-to-snapshot

Commit 46b8da35d79121df34ec9befd353c8c428be846b modified
the method we use to query the backend volumes. But,
revert-to-snapshot implementation which was in-progress
when the above commit was merged missed that change.
Fixing it by updating the query method call in
revert_to_snapshot.

Change-Id: I34cbd4420b43f52cd8d23833658f6386cb3e6437
Closes-bug: #1790008
(cherry picked from commit 258beef2649d79c24ddafaf2064e94557c316bde)

commit_message:
Add postgresql to osh-infra-monitoring job

This adds a deployment step for postgresql to the single node
monitoring job to validate the exporter works as intended

commit_message:
Fail container job if command failed

When script fails, the job continues and passes.  Remove
unnecessary code saving and let the task to fail.
Make script to be generated for easier investigation what
command was running.
Change-Id: I1edce370458769a1479ee568b745e78ddcef693a

Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>
'}]
commit_message:
RabbitMQ: Add ability to change admin password.

This PS adds the ability to change the admin user credentials
and erlang session cookie. To do so requires `--recreate-pods` to
be passed to helm on a release upgrade.

Change-Id: Ib04ad43a7c303a8ddc31fd0de288a2f7f3294a12
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Test BM with VM on the same network

L2 isolation and L3 connectivity between: BM and VM
This test will be skipped if Nova is not running.

Change-Id: I89e84140ceae01eb672ae72b1b10e53ff527e172

commit_message:
Add ipv4 undercloud_external_network when the overcloud is ipv6

Not all envs allow for ipv6 routing. This review adds an
ipv4 option, undercloud_external_network_ipv4, to be used
for routing/masquerade when undercloud_external_network
would return an ipv6 value.

This value is only referenced in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/642924.
When ipv6 is not used, the undercloud_external_network_ipv4
value is never used.

Change-Id: I518bd9973bfd82350f75d2d1b2f444a5fb510a82

"}, {'created': '2019-03-20 16:00:57.000000000', 'message': "Fix how we UTF-8-ify func tests

I noticed while poking at the DLO func tests that we don't actually use

commit_message:
Fix how we UTF-8-ify func tests

I noticed while poking at the DLO func tests that we don't actually use
non-ascii chars when we set up the test env.

By patching the create name function earlier (in SetUpClass) we can
ensure we get some more interesting characters in our object names.

Change-Id: I9480ddf74463310aeb11ad876b79527888d8c871

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
docs: Misc cleanups

Some random cleanups:

- Don't add the root or 'doc/source' directories to PYTHONPATH - it's
  unnecessary since we install nova (ruling out the first) and don't
  import anything from the latter
- Fix weird indentation
- Remove 'sphinx.ext.coverage', which is used to measure API doc
  coverage. This is unnecessary since we don't publish API docs, save
  for the versioned notification docs
- Remove unnecessary settings
  - 'exclude_patterns' referred to directories that haven't existed for
    a long time
  - 'source_suffix', 'add_module_names' and 'show_authors' were set to
    the default value
  - 'release', 'version' and 'html_last_updated_fmt' are all set
    automatically by 'openstackdoctheme' now
  - 'modindex_common_prefix' is useless since we don't expose a module
    index

All rolled into one patch for efficiencies sake.

Change-Id: I0f70c6d71299dedc59884f2bb39c8ea3c2ca8eff
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Retry on DB deadlock when updating resource

Updating a row in the DB using UPDATE...WHERE... seems to be prone to
deadlocks. We already fixed added retries for updates of the Stack table
(bug 1578615); do the same with the Resource table.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/622853/
Change-Id: I3928f1acc3c354711a27523215784a8cf8767581
Closes-Bug: #1732969
(cherry picked from commit e919b723bc6f6604d3165d143de51715fbf057e7)

commit_message:
k8s_fedora: Use external kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack

* Use the external cloud-provider [0]
* Label master nodes
* Make the script the deploys the cloud-provider and clusterroles
  for the apiserver a SoftwareDeployment
* Rename kube_openstack_config to cloud-config,
  for cinder to workm the kubelet expects the cloud config name only
  like this. Keep a copy of kube_openstack_config for backwards
  compatibility.

Change-Id: Ife5558f1db4e581b64cc4a8ffead151f7b405702
Task: 22361
Story: 2002652
Co-Authored-By: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>
(cherry picked from commit 6c61a1a949615f6dc1df36f3098cd97466ac7238)

subject: Improve floating IP allocation
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6484, 'name': 'Feilong Wang', 'email': 'hustemb@gmail.com', 'username': 'flwang'}, {'_account_id': 6732, 'name': 'Lingxian Kong', 'email': 'anlin.kong@gmail.com', 'username': 'kong'}, {'_account_id': 8064, 'name': 'Jake Yip', 'email': 'jake.yip@unimelb.edu.au', 'username': 'jake'}, {'_account_id': 20498, 'name': 'Spyros Trigazis', 'email': 'strigazi@gmail.com', 'username': 'strigazi'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22623, 'name': 'Erik Olof Gunnar Andersson', 'email': 'eandersson@blizzard.com', 'username': 'eoandersson'}, {'_account_id': 28022, 'name': 'Bharat Kunwar', 'email': 'brtknr@bath.edu', 'username': 'brtknr'}, {'_account_id': 28411, 'name': 'Jim Bach', 'email': 'jabach@blizzard.com', 'username': 'imdigitaljim'}]

[{'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-07 03:29:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-03-08 09:58:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Direction looks good to me'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-08 10:06:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Direction looks good to me

Thanks for your feedback, I will continue the work.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-09 06:13:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-03-10 16:45:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I discussed with Spyros before to add a new label to avoid changing the floating_ip_enabled from boolean to enum. For example, we can add a new label named 'floating_ip_enabled_master_only' to combine with the floating_ip_enabled. With this new label we should be able to cover all the 3 cases (even 4), master only, all nodes have IP, all nodes without IP. And it's more safer for backward compatibility."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-10 20:16:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I discussed with Spyros before to add a new label to avoid changing
 > the floating_ip_enabled from boolean to enum. For example, we can
 > add a new label named 'floating_ip_enabled_master_only' to combine
 > with the floating_ip_enabled. With this new label we should be able
 > to cover all the 3 cases (even 4), master only, all nodes have IP,
 > all nodes without IP. And it's more safer for backward
 > compatibility.

Yes, it'd be better if we could keep the current behavior. IIUC, the only thing that breaks the backward compatibility in this patch is that etcd service floating IP is removed. However, I prefer to change the default behavior if there are no companies are already depending on that, considering the current behavior exposes too much information to the public internet, the default model should protect the user as possible as it should. Another reason is, the fix should be easy without an extra label introduced. 

Spyros said it doesn't affect CERN, and I've already sent an email to the community to gather more feedback. If no one is interested or it doesn't affect anyone, I think we are good to go. Your idea?"}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-03-11 01:50:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

＠Lingxian, Yep, I agree with you and Spyros here and I think this aligns with Magnum's security goal."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-11 09:58:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-11 19:47:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-03-11 22:50:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

oh, for workers never have fips?'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-03-11 22:52:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Sounds like it... seems sensible to do this... masters can talk to workers on an internal network anyway... seems wasteful to allocate floating ip to all workers... often fips are scarce resources!'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-11 23:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-12 05:50:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-12 09:50:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 8064, 'date': '2019-03-12 22:31:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Not super familiar with the usage of floating ips, as I personally don't use them for ka8s. But overall this looks fine to me."}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-03-15 07:55:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

(2 comments)

I'll test this today"}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-15 09:54:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-03-15 10:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(2 comments)

I am confused too. What happens if master_lb_enabled=True and master_lb_floating_ip_enabled=False? How will master load balancer work then? I think it is implied when master_lb_enabled=True that floating ip will be assigned.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-15 10:11:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)

> What happens if master_lb_enabled=True and
 > master_lb_floating_ip_enabled=False? 

master_lb_enabled defines HA-mode, master_lb_floating_ip_enabled defines if floating IP is used for HA-mode.

 > How will master load balancer
 > work then? 

I didn't see it couldn't work, what's the problem do you think?

 > I think it is implied when master_lb_enabled=True that
 > floating ip will be assigned.

It's not true. What if the end users want to create k8s cluster for internal use only?"}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-03-15 10:31:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-16 11:17:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-16 11:21:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-03-16 19:05:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-17 03:32:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-03-17 04:00:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> (1 comment)

As I said, we WERE running Mitaka. My point is that if there isn't a good reason to why we are bumping the template, it is better to use the lowest possible version to allow as many people as possible to use the latest version of Magnum.

Upgrading OpenStack services on large Clouds isn't an easy task, and there are many Clouds out there running older versions.

Having that said. Assuming there is a real advantage of bumping the version I really don't mind doing it, but I would prefer to see us using consistent versioning on templates (meaning if we bump it here, might as well start looking at other templates and taking advantage of the new features there as well)."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-17 04:00:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-17 20:34:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

I've removed the usage of 'condition' in the template which needs at least Newton Heat"}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-03-17 20:51:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-03-18 08:30:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

I wasn't against the previous approach. I just wanted a note in the release notes.

This patch set does not set the api_address properly in the stack output.
 


stack@strigazi-desktop-hdd:~/magnum$ openstack coe cluster template show 7ec2185c-8b41-4e90-9eca-f35db5e53751 -c floating_ip_enabled -c master_lb_enabled

| Field               | Value |
+---------------------+-------+
| floating_ip_enabled | True  |
| master_lb_enabled   | False |
+---------------------+-------+
stack@strigazi-desktop-hdd:~/magnum$ openstack coe cluster show d5b3588d-5fd9-482a-b8a3-386f2abe653d -c cluster_tempate_id -c api_address -c master_addresses -c node_addresses -c stack_id -c cluster_template_id
+---------------------+--------------------------------------+
| Field               | Value                                |
+---------------------+--------------------------------------+
| cluster_template_id | 7ec2185c-8b41-4e90-9eca-f35db5e53751 |
| node_addresses      | [u'172.24.4.138']                    |
| stack_id            | 7a25b04e-be58-498d-849e-b0ef640f41ab |
| api_address         | https://10.0.0.172:6443              |
| master_addresses    | [u'172.24.4.73']                     |
+---------------------+--------------------------------------+
stack@strigazi-desktop-hdd:~/magnum$ openstack stack output show 7a25b04e-be58-498d-849e-b0ef640f41ab api_address
+--------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Field        | Value                                                                                      |
+--------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| description  | This is the API endpoint of the Kubernetes cluster. Use this to access the Kubernetes API. |
|              |                                                                                            |
| output_key   | api_address                                                                                |
| output_value | 10.0.0.172                                                                                 |
+--------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+"}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-18 23:56:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-03-20 00:57:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

fips OK

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-07 03:29:16.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Improve floating_ip_enabled

- Remove the etcd floating IP, the etcd service should be dedicated to the
  kubernetes cluster.
- If `floating_ip_enabled`, don't allocate floating IP for worker nodes.
- If `floating_ip_enabled` and `master_lb_enabled`, don't allocate floating IP
  for each master node.

Change-Id: I0a232406deaf112b0cb9e445735d7b49206c676d
Story: #2005153
Task: #29868
"}, {'created': '2019-03-09 06:13:45.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Improve floating_ip_enabled

- If `floating_ip_enabled`, don't allocate floating IP for etcd
  service and worker nodes.
- If `floating_ip_enabled` and `master_lb_enabled`, don't allocate
  floating IP for each master node.

Change-Id: I0a232406deaf112b0cb9e445735d7b49206c676d
Story: #2005153
Task: #29868
"}, {'created': '2019-03-11 09:58:10.000000000', 'message': 'Improve floating_ip_enabled

- Never allocate floating IP for etcd service and worker nodes, no
  matter `floating_ip_enabled` is set or not.
- Do not allocate floating IP for master nodes if `master_lb_enabled`
  is set.

Change-Id: I0a232406deaf112b0cb9e445735d7b49206c676d
Story: #2005153
Task: #29868
'}, {'created': '2019-03-11 19:47:28.000000000', 'message': 'Improve floating_ip_enabled

- Never allocate floating IP for etcd service and worker nodes, no
  matter `floating_ip_enabled` is set or not.
- Do not allocate floating IP for master nodes if `master_lb_enabled`
  is set.

Change-Id: I0a232406deaf112b0cb9e445735d7b49206c676d
Story: #2005153
Task: #29868
'}, {'created': '2019-03-12 05:50:08.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Improve floating IP allocation

- Never allocate floating IP for etcd service.
- Introduce a new label `master_lb_floating_ip_enabled` which controls
  if Magnum allocates floating IP for the master load balancer. This
  label only takes effect when the `master_lb_enabled` is set. The
  default value is the same with `floating_ip_enabled`.
- The `floating_ip_enabled` property now only controls if Magnum
  should allocate the floating IPs for the master and worker nodes.

Change-Id: I0a232406deaf112b0cb9e445735d7b49206c676d
Story: #2005153
Task: #29868
'}, {'created': '2019-03-12 09:50:39.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Improve floating IP allocation

- Never allocate floating IP for etcd service.
- Introduce a new label `master_lb_floating_ip_enabled` which controls
  if Magnum allocates floating IP for the master load balancer. This
  label only takes effect when the `master_lb_enabled` is set. The
  default value is the same with `floating_ip_enabled`.
- The `floating_ip_enabled` property now only controls if Magnum
  should allocate the floating IPs for the master and worker nodes.

Change-Id: I0a232406deaf112b0cb9e445735d7b49206c676d
Story: #2005153
Task: #29868

commit_message:
Improve floating IP allocation

- Never allocate floating IP for etcd service.
- Introduce a new label `master_lb_floating_ip_enabled` which controls
  if Magnum allocates floating IP for the master load balancer. This
  label only takes effect when the `master_lb_enabled` is set. The
  default value is the same with `floating_ip_enabled`.
- The `floating_ip_enabled` property now only controls if Magnum
  should allocate the floating IPs for the master and worker nodes.

Change-Id: I0a232406deaf112b0cb9e445735d7b49206c676d
Story: #2005153
Task: #29868

[{'created': '2018-10-26 18:41:35.000000000', 'message': 'Forbidden to revert volume to a different size snapshot

As mentioned from original design:
"As we support extend volumes at present, we could meet the
case that snapshot is smaller than volume when reverting to
snapshot and it's obviously safe to revert in that case. But we
will still restrict to revert the volume which current volume size
is equal to snapshot, cause we don't support shrink volume yet
(that ability will be used in the generic method, if the driver
don't support revert to snapshot)."

So, we need add a size check before we revert a volume to a
snapshot. If the volume size is not equal to its latest
snapshot size, it will be raise a HTTPBadRequest(400).

Change-Id: Ib3cc95a10870822b9f597d66007699fb40908b61
Closes-bug: #1798503
(cherry picked from commit bfc27c9abaf366b6534ccb9e032cc26fd3ad3b65)
'}]
commit_message:
Forbidden to revert volume to a different size snapshot

As mentioned from original design:
"As we support extend volumes at present, we could meet the
case that snapshot is smaller than volume when reverting to
snapshot and it's obviously safe to revert in that case. But we
will still restrict to revert the volume which current volume size
is equal to snapshot, cause we don't support shrink volume yet
(that ability will be used in the generic method, if the driver
don't support revert to snapshot)."

So, we need add a size check before we revert a volume to a
snapshot. If the volume size is not equal to its latest
snapshot size, it will be raise a HTTPBadRequest(400).

Change-Id: Ib3cc95a10870822b9f597d66007699fb40908b61
Closes-bug: #1798503
(cherry picked from commit bfc27c9abaf366b6534ccb9e032cc26fd3ad3b65)

commit_message:
Handling unexpected python error "NoneType object is not iterable"

The glance documentation states that None (empty image) is a valid
return value. We have to handle this outcome. Adding error handling
helps debugging this unhandled issue

Change-Id: If7c22ac4516f8c2a6ccd8bf6b6ed98409312b138
Closes-Bug: #1798147
(cherry picked from commit d3afc39467c6532344118e8e491409878da9c2dd)

commit_message:
Convert provider drivers to a json string for config file

Setting octavia's provider_driver to a puppet hash results in a invalid
config. This patch converts the has to a json string instead.

Change-Id: If182949664f041bbfa44b62c55ce06fb5bd63e12

commit_message:
Fixing linters test

The stestr version 2.3.1 introduces a function that breaks lint
tests when called by os-testr.
Excluding that version from test-requirements as workaround.
The bug is fixed on master so hopefully the fix will be included
in version stestr 2.3.2.

Change-Id: Ie06ab3e35915601d3af3888f13d72737d4ae81c9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-02 16:53:21.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add agent first loop timestamp

TODO: - UTs, FTs

Added a new parameter in "agents" object: "first_loop_at". This parameter
stores the timestamp of the agent state report once the first agent loop
is finished and all the managed elements (ports, bridges, etc.) are
initialized.

"CommonAgentLoop" inserts the parameter "first_loop" in the agent state
after the fist loop. Linux Bridge and MacVTap agents, using CommonAgentLoop,
report it.

SR-IOV and OVS agents "daemon_loop" are modified too to report this flag.

Change-Id: I0239424f49bd01ebca527c8812dacf2743221ade
Closes-Bug: #1799178

commit_message:
[WIP] Add agent first loop timestamp

TODO: - UTs, FTs

Added a new parameter in "agents" object: "first_loop_at". This parameter
stores the timestamp of the agent state report once the first agent loop
is finished and all the managed elements (ports, bridges, etc.) are
initialized.

"CommonAgentLoop" inserts the parameter "first_loop" in the agent state
after the fist loop. Linux Bridge and MacVTap agents, using CommonAgentLoop,
report it.

SR-IOV and OVS agents "daemon_loop" are modified too to report this flag.

Change-Id: I0239424f49bd01ebca527c8812dacf2743221ade
Closes-Bug: #1799178

rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I4401a2f82860b68a82763de686622457597e7c7b

commit_message:
Add known issue for minimum bandwidth resource leak

Nova will leak minimum bandwidth resources in placement if a user
deletes a bound port from Neutron out-of-band. This adds a note about
how users can work around the issue.

Related-Bug: #1820588

Change-Id: I41f42c1a7595d9e6a73d1261bf1ac1d47ddadcdf

commit_message:
add resource filters to the included data_files

The resource_filters.json file has been added to the included data files
which will allow packagers to rely on the default file instead of having
to carry it as a template.

Change-Id: I2a0120c4ab199ef7ede09a707de8540ce98809af
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>
(cherry picked from commit 64d7a04c1eed4dac6ab8dab40e5a02a4d3389a1d)

[{'created': '2018-12-18 19:20:01.000000000', 'message': "Ensure image utils don't block greenthreads

When doing image operations in Cinder we may start getting errors on
RabbitMQ and DB connections, which result in the volume service
appearing as down to the scheduler.

This is caused by file I/O operations, that in some cases block
greenthreads, preventing switching to another greenthread on I/O as they
should.

This results in many different errors, so this patch makes sure that
image operations (fetch, put, verify image, ...) that could prevent
greenthread switching are executed in native threads.

Closes-Bug: #1801958

commit_message:
Ensure image utils don't block greenthreads

When doing image operations in Cinder we may start getting errors on
RabbitMQ and DB connections, which result in the volume service
appearing as down to the scheduler.

This is caused by file I/O operations, that in some cases block
greenthreads, preventing switching to another greenthread on I/O as they
should.

This results in many different errors, so this patch makes sure that
image operations (fetch, put, verify image, ...) that could prevent
greenthread switching are executed in native threads.

NOTE(s10): Part of the change related to the image verification has not been
backported because image signature verification is only in Rocky.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-30 20:36:21.000000000', 'message': "Fix permissions with NFS-backed snapshots and backups

Fix snapshot issues that occur if cinder does not have regular (non-root)
write permission on an NFS share. This is done by following the volume
driver's model of creating files as root, followed by calling
_set_rw_permissions().

Fix backup issues that occur if cinder's group ID changes, which can
happen when migrating from bare metal to a containerized service. If the
share's group ownership and permission needs to be modified, then do it
recursively so that previously made backups remain accessible.

Closes-Bug: #1807760
Change-Id: I6c20c4825af0a365b6a20fb633c810c2f2fe48b0
(cherry picked from commit 1fb342cba89e63d15dde9db2136bdf34b549e559)
(cherry picked from commit 95f30ea6edc093d9d29a2197c79a7e0b7427728b)
Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_remotefs.py
"}]
commit_message:
Fix permissions with NFS-backed snapshots and backups

Fix snapshot issues that occur if cinder does not have regular (non-root)
write permission on an NFS share. This is done by following the volume
driver's model of creating files as root, followed by calling
_set_rw_permissions().

Fix backup issues that occur if cinder's group ID changes, which can
happen when migrating from bare metal to a containerized service. If the
share's group ownership and permission needs to be modified, then do it
recursively so that previously made backups remain accessible.

Closes-Bug: #1807760
Change-Id: I6c20c4825af0a365b6a20fb633c810c2f2fe48b0
(cherry picked from commit 1fb342cba89e63d15dde9db2136bdf34b549e559)
(cherry picked from commit 95f30ea6edc093d9d29a2197c79a7e0b7427728b)
Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_remotefs.py

commit_message:
Catch socket.timeout for connectivity error when streaming

While fetching remote templates, if there is network issue while
reading data chunks socket.timeout is raised.

Change-Id: I4ebb495706ea3c505a92254b1f03e326b0fa34b6
Story: #2004686
Task: 28694
(cherry picked from commit e3d54b74fad45d786f4c80fff8af5245ecdd1713)

commit_message:
Manila VMAX docs -  clarify driver_handles_share_servers

Clarify that only driver_handles_share_servers = True is supported in
the VMAX manila driver.

Change-Id: Iac40b4d250a87d8c993ec2db5ad1d7e03eab189b
(cherry picked from commit 9aac703672230a1acabdada94f4db16b3151fc58)

commit_message:
Fix for HPE MSA 2050 login failures

When authenticating to the array, use the 'response-type-numeric'
value to determine success, rather than doing a string match against the
'response-type' string, which is not guaranteed to be consistent.

Change-Id: I47fe1ff2dd5e24fffd5118aeab9473774eb58a61
Closes-Bug: #1808968
(cherry picked from commit 0565732a161ccc8bbef729019f7a24f2d862e606)
(cherry picked from commit 883b29cf46e3248ce9cc4061d8312343c20c8192)

Thank you for your contribution.

I must admit, I find it pretty scary to curl an arbitrary binary from the internet to execute it inside a container.

I would really prefer building a traditional software package to install that. Then you'd also have a defined update process, in case
of security issues."}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-03-07 09:14:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I wouldn't go as far as calling it an arbitrary binary, it is the official release binary on the google github page. I know what you mean though, all you have is https here and I can't see any checksums on the download page. For upgrades the normal thing to do would be to bump the version and rebuild the container. I don't really see the need to package it. FWIW, cadvisor and other containers use similar approaches."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-03-07 11:30:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add Google mtail for generating metrics from logs

This adds support for building an mtail image for generating metrics
from logs. These metrics can then be used to trigger alerts. For example,
one may want to track user logins, kernel errors, filesystem corruption
etc.

Change-Id: I0b3eee33c608b08f1e915a08096a1194d359805a
Partially-Implements: blueprint mtail

commit_message:
Delete related encryption provider when a volume type is deleting

Currently volume_type_destroy() in api.py does not delete related
encryption provider (if it exists). As a result, 'encryption' table
accumulates orphaned records.
This patch fixes to delete related encryption provider when
a volume type is deleting.

Change-Id: I90962108ced5043d74b7a7984196b14b2a13eeab
Closes-Bug: 1797640
(cherry picked from commit f3bc40ec34466e8f032160ddc30e9d2f875965c9)

commit_message:
PY3: Ensure LDAP searches use unicode attributes

This is a bug fix that corresponds to changes missed in commit
eca0829c4c65e6b64f08023ce2d5a55dc329248f.

In Python 3, python-ldap no longer allows bytes for some fields (DNs,
RDNs, attribute names, queries). Instead, text values are represented
as str, the Unicode text type. Compatibility support is provided for
Python 2 by setting bytes_mode=False [1]. This support was provided
in commit eca0829c4c65e6b64f08023ce2d5a55dc329248f.

In this patch we ensure that attribute names specified in searches
are no longer encoded.

[1] More details about byte/str usage in python-ldap can be found at:
http://www.python-ldap.org/en/latest/bytes_mode.html#bytes-mode

Change-Id: If3398e2d08ea14fa4b8c498b2a9a7c7edb47b9e5
Closes-Bug: #1820333
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613648
(cherry picked from commit d6df1dff3e519a26c1a12b6c32f9799484be5966)

commit_message:
PY3: switch to using unicode text values

In Python 3, python-ldap no longer allows bytes for some fields (DNs,
RDNs, attribute names, queries). Instead, text values are represented
as str, the Unicode text type. Compatibility support is provided for
Python 2 by setting bytes_mode=False [1].

Update the keystone LDAP backend to adhere to this behavior by using
bytes_mode=False for Python 2 and dropping UTF-8 encoding and decoding
fields that are now represented as text in python-ldap.

[1] More details about byte/str usage in python-ldap can be found at:
http://www.python-ldap.org/en/latest/bytes_mode.html#bytes-mode

Note that at a minimum python-ldappool 2.3.1 is required. For more
details see Depends-On's below.

Change-Id: Ifdd0644cd7042407a008c85c0b2c40a971c90bc3
Closes-Bug: #1798184
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/611401
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/613632
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/614052
(cherry picked from commit eca0829c4c65e6b64f08023ce2d5a55dc329248f)

upper-constraints pins Werkzeug to a known working version. The
lower-constraints job uses a different constraints file, the
locally-maintained lower-constraints.txt, which didn't pin Werkzeug and
resulted in the job breaking on the most recent 0.15.0 Werkzeug release.
This change pins Werkzeug to match the known working version in
upper-constraints. If and when upper-constraints raises its cap, we can

Change-Id: I926e79e34072505f9edc4879b1d9237a3b85accd

commit_message:
Pin Werkzeug in lower-constraints

upper-constraints pins Werkzeug to a known working version. The
lower-constraints job uses a different constraints file, the
locally-maintained lower-constraints.txt, which didn't pin Werkzeug and
resulted in the job breaking on the most recent 0.15.0 Werkzeug release.
This change pins Werkzeug to match the known working version in
upper-constraints. If and when upper-constraints raises its cap, we can
address the breakage on the regular unit test jobs.

Change-Id: I926e79e34072505f9edc4879b1d9237a3b85accd

[{'created': '2018-12-20 11:30:00.000000000', 'message': 'Retry on DBDeadLock affecting worker updates

Some updates on the workers table are prone to race conditions,
leading to DB deadlocks.

For example, when creating a large amount of volumes simultaneously,
some of them may hang in "Creating" state due to this issue.

We'll perform some retries when db deadlocks occur.

Change-Id: Iae211acd619070405f84a84ea58e88723a5e9f9b
Closes-Bug: #1789106
(cherry picked from commit e1fc723db123651ad66a339d559aed578126c74a)
'}]
commit_message:
Retry on DBDeadLock affecting worker updates

Some updates on the workers table are prone to race conditions,
leading to DB deadlocks.

For example, when creating a large amount of volumes simultaneously,
some of them may hang in "Creating" state due to this issue.

We'll perform some retries when db deadlocks occur.

Change-Id: Iae211acd619070405f84a84ea58e88723a5e9f9b
Closes-Bug: #1789106
(cherry picked from commit e1fc723db123651ad66a339d559aed578126c74a)

[{'created': '2019-03-05 15:15:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix Snapshot object metadata loading

The Snapshot object will fail to correctly load
metadata.  Initialize the object fully so that
obj_what_changed() works as intended.

This prevents the error:
   AttributeError: 'Snapshot' object has no
   attribute '_obj_metadata'

Closes-Bug: #1805790

Co-Author: Gorka Eguileor <geguileo@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Idee4836ee3e4f9b9f4099e7a1a3d7a4bada3f7b8
(cherry picked from commit 7ad0b0660c819cc7b2909b7e35cbe5a2fe0aef87)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Snapshot object metadata loading

The Snapshot object will fail to correctly load
metadata.  Initialize the object fully so that
obj_what_changed() works as intended.

This prevents the error:
   AttributeError: 'Snapshot' object has no
   attribute '_obj_metadata'

Closes-Bug: #1805790

Co-Author: Gorka Eguileor <geguileo@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Idee4836ee3e4f9b9f4099e7a1a3d7a4bada3f7b8
(cherry picked from commit 7ad0b0660c819cc7b2909b7e35cbe5a2fe0aef87)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-27 17:34:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix group availability zone-backend host mismatch

Group availability zone is not set correctly in scheduler filter
properties which results in group availability zone-backend host
mismatch. This can lead to volume create failure for volumes in
the group. Fixing it by setting the availability zone in the
request spec in scheduler RPC call.

Change-Id: Icfa437d2d81ed29d0aceee776d86e28862c85274
Closes-bug: 1773446
(cherry picked from commit e08da42d81a6f4a5cbb72216ecddc0c4cf3807f4)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix group availability zone-backend host mismatch

Group availability zone is not set correctly in scheduler filter
properties which results in group availability zone-backend host
mismatch. This can lead to volume create failure for volumes in
the group. Fixing it by setting the availability zone in the
request spec in scheduler RPC call.

Change-Id: Icfa437d2d81ed29d0aceee776d86e28862c85274
Closes-bug: 1773446
(cherry picked from commit e08da42d81a6f4a5cbb72216ecddc0c4cf3807f4)

Bump libvirt-bin version for ubuntu xenial

A new version is available on xenial-security for libvirt-bin[0]

This bumps it to the newer version.

[0] http://changelogs.ubuntu.com/changelogs/pool/main/libv/libvirt/libvirt_1.3.1-1ubuntu10.25/changelog

commit_message:
libvirt: Stick to 4.0.0 version located in main repository

Version 5 of libvirt present in Virtualization repo is too recent
and unnecessary for queens and rocky builds.

Virtualization repo is however necessary for cgroups packages
that are not present in the main repository. It can be deleted once the
necessary packages are installed.

Ceph repo should not be needed at all.

Change-Id: I2d030c0f326cef4571ef6d15056d8afdf7381d69

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-20 11:53:28.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent unicode object error from zero-byte read

During large file uploads under py3, we are occasionally seeing a
"unicode objects must be encoded before hashing" error even though
we are reading from a byte stream.  From what I can tell, it looks
like it's happening when a zero-byte read is requested, so we handle
that case explicitly.  This is a band-aid fix; we still need to track
down the source.

Co-authored-by: wangxiyuan <wangxiyuan1007@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Related-bug: #1805332
Change-Id: Ia7653f9fcbe902abc203c10c80ab44a641a4d8f9
(cherry picked from commit 1d25a2b7a21e95766f9fee378b3d0802d392a85f)
'}, {'created': '2019-03-20 14:09:09.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent unicode object error from zero-byte read

During large file uploads under py3, we are occasionally seeing a
"unicode objects must be encoded before hashing" error even though
we are reading from a byte stream.  From what I can tell, it looks
like it's happening when a zero-byte read is requested, so we handle
